Life is just game, if you play your cards right you can win; No Game No Life is about a world where everything is decided through games in which MC's Sora and Shiro a pair of NEETs who are trapped in this world.
Actual Score 9.2
Story: 8
The story of No game No life is easy to understand and fun to watch as it follows Sora and Shiro's adventures through I world where games decide everything; the story is light hearted and compelling but doesn't take it self serious as it is filled with humour and a touch of fan service which can easily be over lookedby its steady story pacing that keeps giving the viewer more and more that expands the story and keeps it fresh.


Art: 10

The art is outstanding as the scenery is extremely well done and each new piece works new and refreshing, the character art is also really good as it doesn't have the same black outlined characters but rather red outlined which has a lot of affect on the character appearance as the look much more colourful and blend better the with colouring which is also very bright and colourful.

The opening and ending of the anime are good but with the opening it took a while for me to enjoy where as I loved the ending which is sung by Shiro and the songs really fit well with the anime. The OST was also nice as each piece fitted well when ever they were used.

Enjoyment: 10

I loved this and easily one of the best of spring 2014.

I'm really trying to find something wrong with this anime. I really do. The music is so good I downloaded the OST. The artstyle is rich and colorful. The story doesn't rip-off any other anime I know of. The characters and the world are very unique. There's a little bit of fan service involved, but I'm sure even the girls can handle it. If you could watch Kill la Kill, this anime has like half of that amount of pandering.
The anime doesn't have a problem randomly mixing in jokes, which a lot of times just got me off guard and I burst out laughing. Theanime doesn't take itself too seriously, which is good! It also has a lot of easter eggs, although some of them require you to have a considerable amount of knowledge regarding anime or games. Everything related to the story is explained in great detail - to my surprise, I couldn't find any contradictions anywhere. Everything makes sense! It's not about whether the heroes will win (gee, of course they will), it's about how they will win.


So there's a girl with superb intelligence. She could speak and solve puzzle games when she was 1 year old. Anything that has a system, she can figure it out and use it to her advantage. She can calculate the probability of your possible moves in a game of chess several hundreds of steps ahead.


Her brother might not be that smart, but his specialty is "reading" people. He's a manipulative bastard. He knows so well what you are thinking it's actually intimidating. He will tell you what you want to hear ad get you to do what he wants you to.


Together they create [blank]. The gaming group without a name. No one has ever beaten them, be it videogames, which take skill, or gambling like poker. They are a perfect combination. One day they are reborn in a fantasy world, where everything is decided by games, rather than war and killing.


One minor complaint might be that sometimes the explanations of their strategies and the rules is sometimes too fast and you can't absorb all of that right away.

Have you ever been completely and utterly bored by something you love doing so much? It is without saying that with too much love, too much fun, too much happiness--everything eventually seems rather dull.
After all, when one has been unbeatable for so long, and all opponents seem so easy, why would anyone bother to try? 
In No Game No Life, for the siblings and main characters Shiro and Sora, their case for boredom lies in their only source of entertainment--games. With a fabulous record of zero games lost, their arrogance causes them to fall into a trap world, where the two neets are thrown intoa society where everything is decided by games.


- - - - - - - - - - - - 


Undoubtedly, NGNL by Yuu Kamiya proves an excellent backdrop for entertainment. After all, entertainment is the keyword to the whole anime. Moments of serious discussion and intelligent thought regarding "silly games" gives way to a blurt or outburst of perversion on Sora's part. These occasions of comedy that ensue are promising but few in number, while much ranting and explanation of the games are prevalent throughout the story.


The premise of the plot is not completely original, but still refreshing in light of the more narrow-minded survival anime that exists. In a way NGNL has its on take on Survival-anime, and yet, at the same time, does not exactly fall under that category. 


The plot is advanced using a series of games that often feel long-winded and may cause some viewers to fall asleep. Regardless, due the pace of the series vs. the actual content in the Light Novels, this anime and its season ending gives a small foreshadow of a second season. 


As for the characters, Sora and Shiro remain mostly static throughout the work. Genius combined with Analytical Intelligence and utter Confidence results in a tag team that need not change. Other characters, such as Steph, I would not believe to be a main character but rather a supporting one in that she does nearly nothing to move the plot forward.


Ah, that brings to light the fan service. True, the world that Sora and Shiro is not necessarily an Asian Society, and therefore certain--erogenous zones--are more "enhanced" and prevalent. (I'm not saying that big is better, however). Steph is such a case, and judging with all the partial-nudity scenes the animators were trying to make a point with them. Or not, and it could just be to see if viewers get nosebleeds.


However, much of the fan service is not as memorable as the plot, which is always a good thing. Except for in episode 6...but that is another story. :>


The sound is nothing special, standard-fare OP and ED; nothing memorable. BGM is where it should be and as such deserves a higher score. 


The art style was excellent. Sometimes it clearly feels like the Animators had fancy art and animation just to buy time by showing all the locations and area in HD. 


Overall, this is no masterpiece. NGNL has its own flaws, and despite them remains overly entertaining.


No Game No Life has earned a place in my heart, and I hope that through my review I might cause you to watch it and have it earn a place in your heart as well :P


Folks, give it up for Kamiya Yuu's No Game No Life, the imperfect but nevertheless beautiful work.


4.5 out of 5 stars for the excellently animated and entertaining No Game No Life! 


-Jay

No Game No Life, the controversial anime of Spring 2014. Some call it a masterpiece, and rate it a 10/10. Others rate it 6 and claim that it's overrated. So which really is it? Well, in order to decide that, you'll have to watch the anime yourself, but here's my view on the anime. It's neither a masterpiece, nor bad at all. In fact, it's rather an enjoyable anime that I believe everyone should give a try. I'd rate it around an 8/10, which surprisingly only a few people seem to rate it. 
First off, the plot was the part that I enjoyed about thisanime. Of course, recently there have been a plethora of anime that's concept is being trapped in a virtual game/world but No Game No Life's was quite different. But a game where, there's no actual fighting and dying, it's just a world where everything is decided upon by... a game. I mean think about it, a world where everything, including nation's territories, the king of a country, all the money, anything at all was decided on by playing one simple game. Whether it's chess, poker, or anything else, the game's stakes are pretty insane. What the main characters do to win each game is something that's interesting to watch out for. Each nation is considered a piece of a chess board (16 pieces total). The nation that unites all the other nations (by defeating them in games) and collects all the chess pieces on the board gets the opportunity to challenge God, Te, who united all the Gods. 


Our main characters, the two genius NEET siblings, Sora and Shiro aka "Blank" views our real world as just another pathetic game (they have a point). Everyday life for kids just repeats itself, and in society not everybody accepts you for who you are. One day they get invited to a chess match by a stranger (Tet), and after a good amount of time (1 min) they defeat him and are suddenly sent into the world where everything is decided by games. Here, Sora and Shiro play games and try to become the King/Queen of the human race, and end up setting their goal as uniting all the nations/races together and defeating God, and becoming perhaps God theirselves. Sora is such a funny teenager. He seems to be quite the pervert (since he is still a virgin that wants to lose his virginity) and goofer despite him being a genious gamer. That added a less serious, more enjoyable aspect to the anime. Shiro on the other hand kind of annoyed me, because she was a 11 year old girl, whose panties were shown all over the anime; very disturbing. The other characters were interesting, but very confusing and annoying at the same time. I mean Steph is dumb and annoying one episode, then the next episode is smart and kind, but then switches around all the time. PICK ONE PERSONALITY. 


The opening and ending for NGNL are both one of my favorites respectively. Truly amazing music in the anime, I'd definitely tell you to look out for the great soundtrack, and Sora's voice fit him perfectly, as did every single other character. The art was decent. That's all I'll mention about the art.


My enjoyment for this anime was just above average I'd say. I had expected a lot more considering it's recent hype, and high ratings, but nonetheless it was an enjoyable experience that I'd recommend to everyone, all ages.

This will be a spoiler free review so no need to worry, this is my first review so please bear with me.
Well to begin starting this like most other people I thought it was going to be a Sword Art Online reboot but to my surprise they don't want to escape the game, they want to stay in this world so it was nice to see a spin on this often played story.
Story (7)- the story is simple enough for anyone to understand but also goes into depth for people who enjoy those types of shows so it pleases both audiences which i think alot of animes can learn from this. But sadly the story and atmosphere of this serious situation is taken as a joke and once the the mood is serious the vibe is always shattered with a lame joke and i feel it's often distracts the story telling. I do enjoy anime that can successfully balance humor and story telling but this is not one of those animes, timing is everything and i feel this is something the anime needed.


Art (9)- The art is very fun and pretty to look at and for sure has a signature look to it which i think anyone who watches a lot of anime can appreciate, nothing more to say than this. I have no complaints about the art.


Sound (8)- Nothing notable with the exception of intense situations and having a very intense and fitting song. Other than this I didn't notice any other ost tracks that stuck out to me, just casual background music to me.


Character (7)- Okay so I probably had the hardest time judging this section because my personal view of the characters vary so so much and given a solid score from certain characters that score as low as a 4 and others who score as high as a 8, it just makes it hard to give an accurate score. Without giving spoilers to future characters of the series I'll just talk about Sora and Shiro. Well firstly Sora is very annoying and very sweet sometimes, I personally never liked the perv character so he was bound for me not to like him but he does have a sweet side and a strong leader trait that makes him a great person to follow as long as he's not being an idiot. Now the genius Shiro is adorable to watch and her emotionless voice to go along with her colorful personality is just so much fun to watch, for sure one of the best characters in the series, only complain would be just less panty shots of her, like seriously, she's 11 years old, how hasn't a law suit been filed against this shit.


Enjoyment (7)- What a roller coaster this anime was, for me it went from boring to exciting back to boring for an ep or two then exciting then the final game at the start being boring then ending on a high note which was probably the best moment of the show so overall it just left me confused on how to feel about it. This anime has it's moments and when it does it becomes very exciting and if you feel really sucked into the show but when the show becomes boring it's -very- boring and it just feels like I'm watching this just to say i finished it. In short, it has it's moments of both being great and horrible.


Overall (7)- The strong points of this anime are incredible and the weak points of this anime is just torture to watch. So many mixed feelings of this but overall i don't regret watching this and if there is a season 2 I will most likely watch it.

Recipe for No Game No Life: 1: Start with your typical kingdom plot where the underdog kingdom takes over the entire world. 2: Create a main character who you can wholeheartedly believe would do that. 3: Turn it into a harem anime. 4: Take that harem anime and make the main character into the exact opposite of the stereotypes. 5: Have those characters take part in extremely complex and unfair games like in Gamble Fish or Hunter x Hunter, with literally anything on the line. 6: Have them win those games with insanely complex strategies, a la Death Note or Code Geass (all while grinningand being their usual pervert selves) 7: top it all off with a beautiful art style and flawlessly integrated music, both of which are used and changed intentionally and to great effect. 8: Voila, you have the masterpiece that is NGNL!


TLDR: It tries to do and be a whole bunch of different things, and succeeds phenomenally. 


Story: 9.99

This is the only spot where NGNL fails to knock my expectations out of the park. Instead, it just scores a regular home run. Each episode is filled with turnarounds, upsets, and twists galore, but the overall plot of the anime still is, "Let's beat all the other countries." The thing that keeps it from being knocked down a point is the fact that I really could see the characters doing that. The main characters really are the types who would conquer the entire world just to prove they can and win. If you enjoy that type of kingdom-based plot, this is a straight 10 for you.


Character: 10+

This is where this anime really shines. Out of the entire cast, there's only one character who acts like anyone I've seen before, the comic relief/fanservice punching bag/unfortunate soul, and even she is superbly executed, with enough plot and conflict to keep her from feeling like a total prop. (Instead, she just feels like a comparatively dim girl.) The rest of the cast seems to be mold-breaker after mold-breaker. Discovering the characters is a big portion of the fun of this anime, so I won't spoil it, since if I give one amusing anecdote I'll have to give them all, and leave you with a summary of the entire series, because I could go to any moment with a character on screen, and they would be in the middle of a funny story.


Art & Sound: 10

Firstly, the character designs are beautiful. Second, the settings are stunning. Third, the soundtrack is subtle and perfectly accentuates the tone of the moment. Fourth... Do I really need a fourth? The art knocks just about everything out of the park (Though I admit I like the Korean art style a lot and this reminds me of it), the sound track isn't intrusive or absent, the opening and closing themes are amazing, and when they flash the screen to a different color scheme, it's because the entire world changed, not just because someone noticed something.


Enjoyment: 10

The best way to describe what I thought of it overall is to say that I needed to take several breaks because my throat hurt from laughing so much. If you like perverted things mixed in with the regular plot, epic battles of the mind, a lighthearted tone, and characters that feel like they came from Alice in Wonderland, you'll love this show.

No Game No Life is a pretty looking empowerment fantasy, and it succeeds in being just that, but doesn't go beyond its limitations.
What brings it down is the fact that the main characters cannot lose even once or the story will be over. All tension has been thrown out the window. We know the main characters are gonna win, and so do they. What irks me about this is that it's telling the audience that the show is meant to be brainless entertainment, yet it's a story centered around games, wit and intelligence. I am not sure if this is idiotic or secretly genius.
The onething keeping you watching is the question of HOW they will beat their opponents, and if the show does one thing right it is the bombastic presentation of their victories. The journey there can however be improved significantly.\n\n
I do enjoy that our sibling protagonists are pro-active and that they actually enjoy being sucked into another world, setting them apart from the typical heroes that just want to live a normal life. Their comradery is cute and their relationship is thankfully kept platonic. I can't say they ever grow as characters through the story, and I doubt they will in any potential 2nd season.\n\n
Overall, it's a show with plenty of fun but with a shallow core.

I find myself having difficulty organizing my thoughts on NGNL. I wanted to write this review right after I finished the last episode, but then it would only be riding the hype-train and most likely lacking much in perspective. What needs to be said is probably covered in the multitude of other reviews for this anime so what can I write to contribute? 
I found myself skeptical at the concept of NGNL. At first glance, I thought it was something akin to Sword Art Online. And while I found SAO to be a decent enough watch, I don't need to see another "clone" of it.What finally pushed me over the edge and give it a try was due to people I can trust to give me good anime recommendations. Needless to say at this point expectations were high for NGNL to perform.


And did it perform right at the very first episode. If you so much as blink while watching NGNL, you may find yourself missing some philosophical outlooks on life. The juxtaposition between these concepts and the lighthearted presentation is astounding. I'll tackle the one that resonated with me the most.


The concept of "the proud weak" struck a cord deep within me. Regardless of how you put it, we are weak and always will be. Our fangs will never be as sharp as those designed by nature itself to be natural-born killers. We will always be prey, yet somehow we find ourselves at the very top of the food chain. How did this come to pass? How did our ancestors overcome this staggering difference in physical specifications? How did the prey become the apex predator while still being weak?


Logically, most, if not all human beings understand how this came to pass. However, we don't really think about it as we believe this is a matter of course. It's natural for humanity to be at the top because that's just the way things are and always will be. There's no point thinking about something that's as natural as the air we breathe.


Yet what happens when humanity is no longer at the top? What happens when our predators have taken hold of the one thing that allowed us to lay claim to our position of power? What happens when we're back to our rightful place at the bottom, shivering in fear at the mercy of our superiors?


NGNL tackles that question in a way one least expects. At it's core, NGNL is a narrative of the human spirit and the potential we are all capable of. And that by itself is worth watching. Everything else is just a nice bonus wrapped up in one very well presented package.

Spring 2014 had a lot to overcome and prove. 
Why?
On March 28, 2014, a little show called Kill la Kill ended its 24 episode run, and the anime community proceeded to jump into a collective orgy of hype, memes, and skimpy cosplay. (Which I certainly did not mind.) The show became the next big thing, (Previously held by Attack on Titan) and we all wondered if any show in spring could attain even a fraction of the popularity. 
Enter No Game No Life.
The show features a plot that might seem like common fare these days: People in video games. Although this is not exactly thecase for NGNL, it shares many themes, such as vibrant worlds and otakuish characters. Our main characters are Sora and Shiro, a brother sister match made in heaven. Sora is the classic Light Yagami/Lelouch super genius, but replace the suaveness of those two with an undying love for a sibling, as well as being an otaku. The sister, Shiro, is quiet, but as smart as Shiro. Together, they form the collective entity of blank, gamers unbeatable in any game. Suddenly, by some twisssssted turns of events, they are summoned into a magical world of- well, you know where it goes from here. (Fight our way to the top! Huzzah!)


Other characters include Stephanie “Steph” Dola, a dim witted character, used mostly for fanservice and other gags by our main heroes, and Jibril, big breasted and ready to serve. As you can tell, the characters are nothing close to revolutionary, but their interactions certainly make the show interesting. Wether it is Sora fawning over his love for Shiro, or Shiro's torture of Steph, NGNL's character interactions make for a fun time. All these characters, by the end of the series, all become lovable by the end- this is GOOD.


Now, one great thing about the characters is that...well, they look damn good. Hell, this entire show looks damn good. One of the best looking shows I've seen in a long time. It uses a technique that has recently gained populatiry- drawing everything in a red outline. In NGNL's world, this works especially well, as the beautifully designed characters, landscapes, and buildings pop out in a fashion that makes you want to fill your room with wallscrolls of the show. (Unfortunately, I don't have one currently.) This art is poppin, yo, its GREAT.


The fine arts always include two things. Besides visual, music is quite important. Music for this show is done by a collective group of musicians by the name of SuperSweep. (Never heard of them.) It's a romp of exciting tunes, which certainly add to the flair of the series. However, it isn't Kaijura or Kanno level. On the topic of music, the opening song, “This game,” by Konomi Suzuki, is GREAT. I be singing that all da time yo. GOOD. (sings the part of the op that goes NO GAME NO LIFEE)


Onward to the story that I neglected to elaborate 3 paragraphs ago. Our characters are sent into a world in which everything is decided by games. Yup, no war. (Lennon would be proud?) However, this does not mean that racism and class divisions are not rampant. The world is divided into different races, ranging from monsters to ANIMAL PEOPLE YES. 


* ahem *


Sora and Shiro find themselves attempting to take over all of these races, and their respective lands, in an Oda Nobunaga style unification. Unlike Nobunaga, however, they must win games agains the best of the best in each country to finally make their way to the ultimate position to challenge GOD HIMSELF. THIS IS HYPE THIS IS NO GAME NO-


And the credits roll. End of Review.







Wait.




WAIT.



If you're wondering why I prematurely ended the review, its because I wanted to provide some artistic symbolism as to how NGNL ends. Yeah, like that. I mean, one can say it's not their fault. The source material (Light novel, surprise, surprise.) started in 2012, and is ongoing. However...the ending is not acceptable. It makes you think that the next episode would have aired next week, but no...it was OVER.  No excuse for it. There are many ways you can end a show in which the original source material is still going, but this is not one of them. This is my biggest problem with NGNL. Its pretty glaring. BAD.


* takes deep breath *


Well, now that that is over, did NGNL successfully kill Kill la Kill. Noo. But is it damned good? Yeah. Yesyesyes watch it cause its good and steph is so god damn- 


VERY GOOD 8/8 MATE (8/10)

First and foremost, many people have decided to either not watch or drop  no Game no Life solely on the fact that it is similar to Mondaiji-tachi ga Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo? The similarity is much as SAO is to Log Horizon. And being similar does not necessitate being bad. I personally found NGNL and  Mondaiji-tachi ga Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo? to have completely different mood and execution despite the similarities.
STORY:
I found No Game No Life to be a very interesting story that is both laid back and serious at the same time (in a funny way). As youmay know, the 2 main protagonists,Sora and Shiro, are summoned to to a alternative world, by the God of games(play), Tet. In this world war and fighting is banned and everything is to be resolved by games. I believe this is where the real meat of the show is. The games are exaggerated and blown up to such a level that every minute through  you are mentally saying "is this actually happening".  The writing for these games are absolutely genius. While people may complain, as they always do, about how there is flaws in these games, it is precisely these flaws that create the opportunities to make the games so unbelievable (in a good way). Your in a game world, where ally you can do is play games, im sure people can come up with wacky and illogical solutions to a problem, especially Sora ans Shiro who have played games their entire life. Also despite what other people say about the plot, I believe the games itself are a major part of the plot. If you understand what i means you will see the games itself are the story. The only problem I faced with the story is they try to do too much at the same time. playfulness, adventure, humor, fan service etc. I would say stick with one or 2 main categories and develop those.


Story: 9.37/10



ART:


The art fits the characters and the story perfectly. The bright vivid pinks along with the illogical bright warm colors continuously remind you this is a game world, or this itself is a game if you want to think about it more deeply. Part of the reason why I think the protagonists can do crazy stuff is because this feels like a game, a open free world where you can do almost anything. The art gives you that feeling and atmosphere. I also like how the characters curves, vectors and shading felt more 2D than 3D. I also like how they did not take the characters to super high definition despite the technology. Now imagine of the character quality looked similar to strike the blood or some other high Def anime.  The art style reminded me of log Horizon, which i really, really prefer in this sort of anime. 


Art: 9.82/10 



CHARACTERS:


by far the characters are the weakest. So far the anime has mainly shown static characters. Meaning Characters that do not change. It is still early in the anime so this could change. We were introduced to Shiro and Sora as super good (god-like) at game, with high intelligence and logic deduction capabilities and that has not changed through out the anime.Now static does not necessitate bad. Mikasa from Attack on Titan is a static character yet is a complete badass.  Both of them are also bad with crowds, hence them being NEETS. I dont want to spoil, but there were problems with the core of the characters during the speech and ill leave it at that. One of the characters is truly a dumb dumb and made for fan service. Now this may a be both a good thing and a bad thing. Now Sora and Shiro have taken advantage of this a few times but in the end i feel that character will just get boring after a while (unless he/she changes).


Characters:  7.58/10




ENJOYMENT


I love it. I find a good show, not when it has a good story or character or music (though those are great to have). A good anime is one that engages me to a point that i start to forget about the negatives. No show will be perfect but great shows hide their imperfection. PS i did not steal this quote, i came up with it on the spot.



Enjoyment: 10/10



OVERALL:   between 9.4 & 9.6 /10

No Game No Life is a story about Sora, an 18 year old man and he's 11 year old Shiro and together they known as Blank, a undefeated team of gamers. After game there between the two of them, playing as four different characters at the same time and beat over 1000 gamers, they get challenged by someone name Tet to a game of Chess. After being Tet, He offers the two to a world where games replace war, thinking it's a joke they accept and transported to the world of Disboard. Tet reveals that he the god of this world and explains the rulesof his world, the Ten Pledges and tell them to enjoy themselves. I would keep going, but i feel like that enough about the story as i don't want to spoil anything. The story has been well written as i could find anything in show to contradict itself as some time so animes do, so i happy this wasn't the case. The story itself has a lot of think to keep you guessing thats going to happen next and really show you how important the main characters are to each other.\n
Next the design, No Game No Life seen to follow the art style of other animes like Sword Art Online in turns of color and design. This art style really makes the anime stand out as the details in the characters and the environments are well created and make the show come to life. The sounds are also been well made as all the background sounds and music fit whats happening on screen very good and helps make the anime more alive. Last part of design is the characters, all the characters' design has been well-thought-out as the detail on the characters is some the best i seen in an anime. The voices of every character in the show worked very well as not once i thought that - oh that voice doesn't sound to good or oh i don't think you should of gave them that voice, but thats my opinion so you may think differently.\n
Lastly my thoughts about No Game No Life, I found that i really enjoy this as it has the look of Sword Art Online and the detail of Log Horizon but able to do these better than both. The characters have been so well created that you can really understand and care for them as they don't feel lifeless, and the art and music makes it come to life. The story will make you feel that you want to see the next episode.\n
So that in mind i say that No Game No Life is a well created and one of the most interesting anime i ever seen, I recommend it to anime lovers who watch Sword Art Online and Log Horizon and to people new to anime as it one of the best animes out there and to start getting into anime.

No game no life is one of my favorite anime in this season as it have good ideas and many memorable event.
Story- The drifters who drifted into the fantasy world with game as part of the diplomacy, warfare and ideology is fresh. The overall story is plain and don't have many moment to pray protagonist to beat the villain. But details of the game, tricks that have been used make many memorable moments in this anime, good job. 10/10
Art- The world of game is very beautiful as what fantasy world should be. It's also surprising to see towns of individual races. And what I likethe most is the screenplay, it's easily make the bland character's bibliography look interesting. But I feel like some character doesn't look very good eg. Shiro. 9/10


Sound- Some characters have very annoying voice. I really annoyed Kurami voice , her high pitched sound really screeching like drawing blackboard with chalks. But thanks to every VA that they had captured every characters personality and what they have to do. This make corny jokes become memorable events. 8/10


Character- The character setting possibility play the great role in the story. Unique personality of main characters really got me. However, Sora personality can be annoying as well as memorable, as some of his speech is awful. 8/10


Enjoyment- As above said, I'm very enjoy watching this series and I would watch if it have second season. 10/10


Overall- It have many awful and awesome moment in this anime. But the awful one isn't the main part of the story. So I recommend this anime to anyone who get bored with fantasy world with knights, dragons, brave protagonist and  etc. 9/10

This is the anime where everyone reccomends to their friends and call what their friends watch as "shit". The anime where the fanbase is more aggressive and nasty than the SAO fanbase. The anime where people lose their friendships more than they did to monopoly. Yes, that is No Game No Life. The anime where Madhouse was in charge of, and of course one of the most overhyped and overrated series that was released in 2014
Story:5
Yep, the story is mediocre, there I said it. Come at me butthurt fans. The story is nothing original, the main character gets teleported to another world and has tofight stuff (in this case they had to fight with games), there are a lot of animes where it involves transporting to another world, Mondaiji-tachi ga Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo?, Ixion Saga DT, Dog Days, and many more, but why did this get more attention than the other animes that involves transportation to another world? No one really knows, moving along to the synopsis. This anime is about Sora and Shiro, two siblings who have been NEETs, hikikomori, otakus, whatever you prefer, for their entire lives. These two have been known as gaming prodigies who can beat anyone in no time, but one day they suddenly get a Chess challenge from an unknown player and face them. The game went on for hours and hours until Sora and Shiro finally won, but once they won there was an email that suddenly popped up with a bunch of questions that were asking them about their life and suddenly get transported into another realm. As they get transported there they meet a girl named Stephanie Dola, the granddaughter of the Imanity King,(romanized version of her name, since there is no L in the japanese alphabet, so i heard) and help her fix the Imanity kingdom due to her grandfathers mistakes. This is basically a summarization of the first episode and there's more to cover, but I'm pretty sure nobody wants to read so much.


Art:9

The art was to the point where you could ejaculate multiple times just from seeing the opening. The art was just beautiful, you got to see vibrant colors glistening on each character and just everything. The art was on-point well done by Madhouse, they have the best art honestly.


Sound:7

Great, great opening This Game by Konomi Suzuki potrayed what the anime was basically going to be about and pumped you up for the series itself. Some sounds throughout the anime felt like it was reused from Mahou Sensou (the piece of trash that tainted Madhouse), but I'm not so sure. I'm not too keen with my ears anymore.


Character:5

The characters were honestly not flat, but not dynamic at the same time either. Sora being a badass was great, Shiro being the smart loli that everyone loves, Stephanie being the drama queen that makes the series more "intense", and Jibril being the comedy relief yet the fan service provider at the same time. The voice actor for Sora, Yoshitsugu Matsuoka, who voiced in Sword Art Online, Aboslute Duo, and many more potrayed Sora very well. I have nothing to say about the rest since I don't know much else about them.


Enjoyment:7

This was definitely one of those animes that made me pumped throughout each week for every new episode. Though it went downhill as soon as the "Izuna Arc" ended, I saw it coming since the series was coming to an end, but still I felt a bit heart broken when the series ended.


Overall:7

Definitely one of the overhyped and overrated series in 2014, ask someone what the best anime they've seen is and I'm 69% sure they'll reply back with "OF COURSE IT'S NO GAME NO LIFE YOU LIL SHET" and the fanbase much more aggressive, as I said earlier in the review. The show was good, but definitely not the best. The show is a solid 7/10, but butthurt fans will come out of their caves and start bashing on me.

I liked and recommend this anime
Some might say the big flaw in the anime is that they blatantly say that the [Blank] is unbeatable. Yes that would fizzle the tension of "who's going to win" but they put effort into making the actual games interesting. This made me as a viewer to really focus on their journey rather than the outcome with the definite climax at episode 7. I do feel bad though when other characters are made to look so stupid relative to Blank. 
The fanservice was obvious but it was incorporated pretty seamlessly imo with the setting and tone of the show soI had no problem with it. I don't despise fanservice as a whole, just when it seems inappropriate or forced just like any other story device. I was surprised that the animation turned off some viewers because I thought the colorful atmosphere and the environment was fun to look at. Soundtrack was average but the opening was great.\n\n
Lastly, I appreciate that the ending was relatively conclusive imo in that it didn't seem to beg the watchers to go to the manga. Hopefully, there will be a season 2. In conclusion, I have a positive view of this series due to right expectation management. I didn't expect anything compelling but it surprisingly did go the extra mile to really delve into the journey/analysis of the games.

No Game No Life is an anime about a duo, brother and sister, who are NEETs and completely own everything in the game world that they are suddenly tossed into, by this dude called 'Tet'. But the specifics aren't important, let's jump straight into why this anime is downright awesome but makes absolutely no sense at all.
Story: 6/10
The entire plot is actually not very deep, but to be fair, it only had 13 episodes to it, and I'm expecting a sequel so I can't say much about how complete it is. The originality behind it though, simple genius. The anime at first may not seemto take itself seriously with all the ecchi scenes, which I do find unnecessary, but when it comes to the type of games being played, this script really shines. If you appreciate the science (and art) behind game theory and mechanics, you will absolutely love the story and the type of games going on in this anime.


Where it falls short, however, is of course, that the anime doesn't actually seem to be heading in any purposeful direction other than "I want to beat God". But I guess, that's fine for me since it's only 13 episodes. I can't say there are any plot twists, because everything is predictable except for exactly how the main characters win. And when you figure out how they win you'll just either be blown away or just dumbfounded (and slightly cheated) by the way Blank wins almost every single game.


I have to minus points for the fact that although the plot was really shining in the first few episodes, when it came to the part about the Reversi game with Kurami, they completely glossed over exactly how Blank managed to beat Kurami in reversi anyway. Suddenly we see Shiro placing 3 pieces in a row (in this game I thought it was turn-based?) and somehow winning the game despite being unable to even see the board.


Another major draw back was that in the end, the method in which they defeated the "ultimate game" was slightly too far off to believe it would actually work. Even if Shiro could calculate, it doesn't mean she had absolute knowledge about the scripts that the game was running on, so that didn't make much sense. And even if that could happen, there was completely no telling that they would arrive at the final destination at the exact timing in which the fox girl powered down.


Art: 10/10


Amazing. The art is just simple amazing. You can describe it with just one word "Rainbows." Everybody is a rainbow, and the character art, background art is just beautiful. I never knew there were so many colours in the world until I watched this anime. The visuals are simply stunning.


Sound: 8/10


OP anime theme is downright awesome. It's upbeat, exciting, everything you want in it. Background music excels in this anime, gets everything hyped up especially within the games. As for, the ED theme, it was pretty decent as well.


Character: 7/10


Unfortunately, as enjoyable the Blank combination is as a character, and as awesome as they are, I have to minus points for the fact that every other character is basically being outplayed and outclassed by Blank, leaving little room for growth or depth in character development. Still, it was 13 episodes long, so that's understandable in every way. I absolutely love the main character though, everyone else just seems to get horribly sidelined, and I wish I could have seen more of their impact on the game. Also, Blank is quite imbalanced as a character, and literally can calculate in supercomputer proportions and seemingly impossible theorems.


Enjoyment: 9/10


Pacing and everything is just right in the anime. It's exciting, it gets you hooked from the get-go, and the only thing that may turn viewers down is that they explain it a bit too fast, so some viewers may have to end up rewatching or pausing at the explanation several times before they get it, but it was pretty decent for me. Most of the laughs came out of just fanservice though, but I enjoyed the games they were actually playing. (The one they played with Jibril was notably quite hilarious).


Overall: 7/10


Unfortunately, for a 13-episode anime, I cannot give it an overall rating above 8 because it just doesn't bring enough depth to the table. But still, a very impressive anime, and the sequel is a must-watch!

"Whether were up against elves or god, Blank never loses" ~ Sora
Truer words have never been spoken.
No Game No Life(NGNL) is one of the most controversial anime in recent history. It's an anime that people either shun, or they love. And both sides have very legitimate reasons for supporting their beliefs. But is it really that good(or bad)?
Story:- 7/10
I, like many others, LOVE the premise of NGNL. The idea of living in a world where everything is decided by games has brilliant potential to be an amazing anime. But I feel that NGNL misused this potential. The story has two major flaws. The main characters,Sora and Shiro, are AMAZING at games. They have never lost a game in the real world and even in the new game world, they have no intention to lose, and the don't lose. EVER. 


This makes the story extremely predictable and at times, boring. I never found the conclusion of any game to be even remotely surprising. The enjoyment doesn't come from the ending of the game, it comes from the road to reach that conclusion. Although this makes the games enjoyable it doesn't give the element of suspense that "game" anime need.


Including the misused potential, the story feels a bit rushed. But the biggest flaw of the story is the completely inconclusive ending. It's a completely crap ending that doesn't solve anything or even give a cliffhanger. It just ends abruptly. If a second season is made, then the story probably will rise to an 8 out of a 10.


Overall, the story has an immense amount of potential, but it's potential is completely misused due to a predictable plotline and a disgusting ending.



Art:- 8/10


The art style of NGNL is arguably amazing. But due to the bright nature of the show, that's debatable. The show uses an extremely high amount of pink, and before I sound like a sexist, no, the color itself doesn't bother me. But the excess of any color annoys me and this anime drops like 200 liters of pink on the screen. It caused a small strain to my eyes which did take me out of the anime. But, to be fair, the art style compliments the anime very well. It''s a very unique art style to choose out of the many that they could've.


The fanservice is what REALLY bugs me. It's abundance throughout the anime is extremely grating. While I do understand that much of the humor of the show comes from the fanservice, there still was a huge amount of fanservice, and it got in the way of the actual visuals and took my attention away from many main plot points.



Sound:- 8/10


The sound of NGNL one of it's high points. The opening of the show is of very good quality and the ending is pretty good. The soundtrack is very good and each track compliments the scene they represent in the anime. The only fault I find with the soundtrack is that none of the tracks are of high quality when listened to without the visuals complimenting it.


The Japanese dub of the show is, naturally, pretty good. Every voice actor does their respective character's personality justice.



Character:- 4/10


The characters of NGNL is where it lacks the most. None of the characters are developed at all throughout the series. So let's look at the roster and see how bad it really is.


Sora: To define Sora, you can call him a comedic version of Light(Death Note) or Lelouch(Code Geass). He's a cocky dick, but he has complete reason to act like one. He also is obsessed with women, and is probably a pervert?


Shiro: Shiro, the sister of Sora, is an emotionless version of Sora. She can easily predict what artificial intelligence will do. And like Sora, she also can be classified as a pervert? And she's 11, by the way.


Stephanie Dola: Steph is the fanservice pig and the exposition pig of the show. She exists for the sole purpose of explaining the protagonist's plots to the viewer. It is in this way that I feel that her character was completely misused.


The rest of the characters are all underdeveloped and bland pieces of garbage. By judging the amount I've written about the characters, you can tell that the character have no depth at all.


Also, aside from the god Tet, Sora and 2 others, all the other characters in the show are female. Let that sink in.



Enjoyment: 9/10


Even if the story and characters of the show are bad, the show was extremely enjoyable. It got a lot of laughs out of me and it also made me clap for the genius protagonists many times over.


OVERALL:

PROS:

+Good premise

+Good music

+Likable main characters(Even if they are underdeveloped)

+Good animation

+Very enjoyable


CONS:

-Poor execution of the story

-Underdeveloped characters

-Art can cause strain on the eyes

-Horrible ending

-Heavily misused potential


Final Score: 7/10

No Game No Life Review
Story
Good flowing story that is sure to excite next season too. The story is very exciting and interesting. I won't go over it because there is a synopsis that tells you all you need to know before watching the anime.
Art
Doesn't fail to impress. I first watched this as it aired, then just now started watching the bluray version. The art is even more impressive this time which also features some scenes being nearly completely redrawn. 
Sound
Opening track is great, works very well for the anime. Sound effects are noticeable and meaningful as is most of the background music.
Character
Sora and Shiro areblank characters. They are easy to understand and likely will not change until [something] happens. That being said, apparently Stephanie is a main? it doesn't seem like it. Steph definitely needs a little more development. \n\n
Enjoyment\n
Comedy was pretty funny. The art and the story combined can make the show seem breath-taking. There were times that I became enthralled in watching this anime, and every single savory moment.\n\n
Overall\n
I would recommend this anime to anyone. It was totally enjoyable and very interesting to watch. Unless you crave for a certain niche, then watch this. On another note, this show doesn't leave much of an aftertaste. Although I would prioritize the second season of this show over most, it just lacks a little bit of impact, but it is still great.

Story: Oh, how I came across this anime was pretty...well, like how I came across any other anime actually. Before my high school career ended, I met a boy who turns out to be my college best friend, Luis, who was watching it and recommended it to me. He said that the anime was about two kids going into a world where it was all about games. Okay, something new, fine. Little did I know what I was getting myself into. The story is very interesting because the main mission is for Sora and Shiro to become the greatest gamers in the gaming world. That'sit. Nothing distracts the purpose in all twelve episodes. Though the gaming setting is not that original, it was the first time since Sword Art Online I've seen something that's not having to beat all of the levels to escape. In fact, Sora and Shiro (brother-sister duo) don't even want to escape. They hate their own world more than anything. However, most of the scenes are fan service for men. Sometimes, the only way to defeat a person in the games has to deal with fan service. Because of what I can explain, I would rate this section a 7 out of 10.


Art: Fan service and pedophilia is most I can say about art. My closest friends know that fan service is the one thing that destroys good anime. Most of the scenes in this anime are of Stephanie Dora's chest, almost vagina (Luis told me that the manga was full fledged nudity and to save my sanity by not reading it), and naked little girls. Why I chose to watch it? Well, I wasn't informed it was going to be that bad! Still, I like how some of the characters look with their clothes on, but it didn't strike me to be so impress. I rated this section 5 out of 10.


Sound: The theme song to this anime is one of my favorite theme songs of all fucking time. Luis exactly performed the song on guitar for me once, and I was very impressed. Like Ouran's ending theme, this ending song didn't impress me much either. However, I did find the little clips of young Sora and Shiro to be cute. The music for the battle scenes did bring some suspense and excitement to when it was the most important. Because of those reasons, I rated this section 9 out of 10.


Characters: If you want me to be honest with you, I didn't find every single character in this anime to be...likable. I mean Shiro's okay because I felt bad for her after watching her backstory. When Sora disappears, I felt even more bad for her because that was when I realized she had more personality than the tired, Wonder Bread one I saw a lot of times before. Stephanie knew what was up some of the time, but she acted like a damsel in distress for the rest of it. I almost hated Sora at first, but I came to realize that he was my favorite character in the whole series. Though he has perverted tendencies, he's really smart and he has a protective personality towards Stephanie and Shiro when they are in danger. The thing that pissed me though that I never got Sora's backstory on why he hates society back in the real world. I see him have panic attacks, but I never got the reasons why for them. I rate this section 8 out of 10.


Enjoyment: As far as enjoyment goes, I wouldn't get too excited about this show. I guess it's all about preference, but I wouldn't rewatch this if I was forced to. There were some occasions when I just wanted to get rid of this show off of my watching list, but there was something that made me watch all twelve episodes just to see what happened. Would I want a second season of this show since it left on such a cliffhanger? Probably not, but I don't know just yet. I rate this portion a 6 out of 10.


Overall: Again, it's all about preference. If you guys want to see No Game No Life for yourselves, I won't stop you. After putting numbers together (God, I hate Math.), the overall rating for this show to me is 7 out of 10. I do have to say that if you're really against fan service, especially if it's girls having to show their privates to get viewers, don't watch this. You'll be pissed off all of the time.

No Game No Life was a hell of an adventure. Even with a semi-predictable/generic setting, the execution and phrasing of everything was simply brilliant. Everything seemed to be timed and packed with suspense so that there wasn't even a moment when I thought, "Man, when will this monologue finish?"
I would be giving this anime a perfect ten if only the development as a whole was as steady as the phrasing of the plot. What I mean is that it almost seemed inconsistent on the amount of attention every character got. It was very bland in terms of the roles the characters played. Sora and Shirowas the good guys, Kurami was the tsundere, Steph/Jibril were the fanservice etc.


Another problem about the show (at least from my perspective) was the overemphasis of the fanservice. Now I'm not saying fanservice is a bad thing, but is it really appropriate to put so much of it in No Game No Life to the point where it distracts the viewer from the main plot?


My last problem I had with NGNL was the fact that the show itself treated the viewers like they were stupid. Although I have to admit that I couldn't keep up with everything going on, I at least would feel better if Sora had stopped using monologues/Steph as a 3rd party device for the viewer to understand what was going on.


So overall, NGNL gets a solid 9 from me. The major overarching problem is just that it wasn't very sure of it's audience. From my point of view, I can't really tell if NGNL was supposed to be an ecchi fantasy harem or a brilliant show for people who want to put their minds to the test a bit.


Well, thanks for reading! I know my arguments were slightly inconsistent, but  I'm still very happy that you took the time to read my review!

Before you look at the 6 rating, click on "Overall Rating" to see what i rated each element.  I did really enjoy this series, but there was some strangeness going on here.
There are tons of glowing reviews about this thing, which i believe comes down to an eerie similarity to Gurren Lagann's main character and the main character for this anime.  Personally, I didn't like Gurren Lagann at all.   It was too extreme and cheesy for me to handle.  and it leapt through time faster than i could keep up, so it got dropped.
Strike one: using a beloved archetype forMC


At times i felt the art was way to saturated, making it almost painful to look at.  The colors were way to extreme for me to appreciate.  The art over all wasn't the greatest, but dayum the fluidity was pretty amazing with the animation.  It definitely saved the day imo.


Strike two:  hodor!


Admittedly, I picked this show up b/c of the high praise that reached my ears.  I was highly skeptical after reading the premise, but decided there must be something special inside.  And most anime has terrible premises but they never slow a good show down.  And when a show has a great premise (Naruto) well....fillers and poop.  But onward frens to strike 3!!!!


THIS ANIME IS A CARBON COPY OF Mondaiji-tachi ga Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo?

myanimelist.net/anime/15315/Mondaiji-tachi_ga_Isekai_kara_Kuru_Sou_Desu_yo


So its basically the same show.  It's not "like" Mondaiji, it IS Mondaiji with different characters.  One show got CRAPPED all over for the MC being way to over powered, the other show is being heralded as ANIME OF THE DECADE.  So forgive me for being a little confused, especially as a big fan of Mondaiji ~.  With that said, since i liked Mondaiji alot, and am still very sad there is no sequel, i did very much enjoy No Game No Life.  Its impossible to like one and not the other.  Or is it?  


Strike three:  Plagiarism


All in all, i'm just surprised by the reception of this anime.  I thought there was some interesting things in it, i liked the pacing alot, i liked the mind games and puzzles, it was just really interesting.  But the one serious critique is that it's a show that you know exactly where its going.  you just don't know how it gets there.  Not my favorite type, but they did a good job for PLAGIARIZING THE SHIT OUT OF MONDAIJI

No Game No Life is not your average gaming anime series. No, it's much more than that.
You follow the story of a brother and sister duo, Sora and Shiro, who are known around the world as the greatest player ever, known as "_____" (blank). They receive a message one day from someone unknown, asking if they believe they have been born into the wrong world. Confused, they are then offered to play a game of virtual chess, and while playing, they get sucked into an alternate reality where things are all determined by playing a game.
 I love the development of all the characters, andhow everything that they do is explained in the most extravagant way of thinking. The art style will also just keep you hooked, along with the hilarious character interactions. \n\n
I hope this show gets a second season, from where it left off, but it is one of my favorites this year. It's not anything like SAO or Log Horizon, but if you like those shows, go for this. Give it a shot, you won't regret it!

[May contain spoilers]
"If there was world, where simple games decided everything? What would you think about that?"
I could compare this to 'Sword Art Online' or all the of the other 'game' anime but to be honest this my first 'game' anime. So i'll leave the story for last.
Art ~ would be a '9' for me.
If I could say one thing about this anime, it has a beautiful art style and a big color palette, kind of like a pastel coloring. I could at the very least say that one of the strong points of the anime is the art direction.
Sound ~ is a solid '8'.
It'snothing special, I didn't really feel the overall sound of the anime affected too much of one scene but it doesn't leave the scene feeling lackluster too. The OP and ED are the ones that stand out, I love the ED.\n\n
Character ~ 's get a '7' for me.\n
The characters aren't really on the 'groundbreaking' scale, they're very average and that's how I think they want you to feel. Average people experience extraordinary adventures. Though the 'brother and sister' relationship is pushing their limits, although they mostly do those weird stuff to win theirs games. Although I feel Sora and Shiro can get away with it because I really can feel how close they are to each other. Their names match too, 'White Sky', how lovely.\n\n
Story ~ I'm not familiar with this genre of anime but I'll give it a '8'\n
A story about a game intrigues me as we all enjoy playing a game once in a while. I thought the idea of a world where you end conflicts over games instead of war, death, etc ... was a great idea. That's where the idea of "Have you ever felt like you we're born on the wrong world?" we all have felt this once in our lives. \n\n
Enjoyment ~ I enjoyed this for my first 'game' anime' so it get's a '8'.\n
From the anime I watch, I enjoy it when they try to challenge your mind. Try to predict might what happen. Though this is shattered by the almighty 'Blank never loses.' It kind of removes the unpredictable outcome but I still have fun on how they achieve their victory.\n\n
Overall ~ , it's a '8'.\n
The show successfully piques the interest of the concept of a 'game world.' An anime which I enjoyed to the end, made me laugh like a madman in a madhouse. The fights are very creative, games that are original. This anime is bursting with charisma and a pinch of creativity, paired with amazing visuals that could be compared to a framed picture.\n\n
I just hope MADHOUSE adapt's a second season, I wanna see them battle their way to the top and beat Tet. I guess the anime achieved what it wanted from me, longing for a conclusion.\n\n
After watching this I still want more, 12 episodes felt too short for me, I still felt the need for more. I definitely recommend watching this anime if you're interested in a 'game' anime that is captivating and immerse.

No Game No Life is the anime, that can easily become one of the most popular ones out there, if the next seasons deliver. Madhouse always knows what to bring to keep things fresh, don't they?
You might like this anime if:
-You like anime that focuses on the battle of wits
-You are looking for an original premise
-You are looking for something funny
-You want to watch something in one sitting
You might dislike this anime if:
-You can't stand unnecessary fanservice
-You didn't watch too many anime
-You can't stand resolutions that seem to come out of nothing
-You'll dislike its humour. It's very specific
Story: 9
You know that "inside video game" trendin anime right? It started after Sword Art Online aired. Why am I bringing that up? Because this is basically a completely new and unique take on that genre. Here, we have a world, that runs on games, not specifically video games, but all types of different ones, like gambling, chess, rock, paper, scissors or even random bets. All of these things can change the world, simply because even a flip of a coin can decide on lives of many or the borders of a country. But what happens when you put the ultimate gamers inside this universe? Well, No Game No Life happens.\n
This is one of the most fun settings that has been provided in a long time. It has it's flaws, for example the outcome of each game can be predictable, or some rules and actions seem to come out of nowhere, but other than that, it keeps a steady flow for the entire 12 episodes. It definetely ends on a satisfying note, but nowhere near being complete. There is also a lot of fanservice, but at some points, I almost wanted to clap, because of how neatly it was implemented. The humour is very specific. If it doesn't grab you in the first episode or two, it will most likely not fit yours. There is also a lot of references to other media, video games and anime, so you will enjoy it more if you watched other series. Just a few references are from: Jojo's Bizzare Adventure, Hyouka, Pheonix Wright, Yu-Gi-Oh, Steins;Gate and even Skyrim. Overall, a fantastic setup with a fantastic pace, but some stuff can be obvious or pulled out of thin air.\n\n
Art and Animation: 9\n
Describing the art syle of this anime in one word is the easiest thing in the world. Here it goes: Unique. It definetely has one of the most unique colour pallets, everywhere you look it's just dripping from every corner. Throughout the series you can probably spot most of the hues known to men (specifically men, women know way too many colours). At times it felt like too much, but for the most part it was perfectly composed. The animation is also right on par. It can make some really memorable moments shine even brighter, and it only gets better the more you push forward. Overall, this anime is a pleasure to look at.\n\n
Sound: 9\n
Hey remember that word that has been around this review a lot? Yeah that one. It fits the soundtrack as well. What was it again? Oh yeah. UNIQUE. Well it's Madhouse so it can't honestly disappoint, but it feels like they took an extra step to make this OST deviate just a bit more. It perfectly fits this fantasy world, with not too many blood pumping themes, but instead more steadily paced ones and ones that almost feel like they have been taken straight from a Bethesda game. Please don't lynch me, but I don't think that the original opening is that great, I only like the covers, thus this is not a ten. But hey, music is subjective after all. Overall, a truly amazing arrangement of perfectly fitting tracks.\n\n
Characters: 8\n
The cast here is pretty great, but I don't feel like any of them really stand out of the crowd of other characters. That is not a bad thing of course, if you can make an already established thing and polish it to perfection, and this anime does that. Mostly. Because you see, there is this one character, that is present mostly to, well, be hot and provide fanservice. I'm looking at you Stephanie Dola. I've seen people defending her, telling people that she means a lot to the MC and so on, but well, that is not my opinion. She does have pretty funny scenes though. But I can't complain about the others, they had their fair share of funny and memorable moments, but that contributes more towards the story aspect. The character development also appears, but not too often. Overall, the cast is great, it's just that other than the scenes they are in, they would more than likely not be too memorable.\n\n
Enjoyment: 10\n
Who cares about anything, this show is so much fun. You can just sit down and marathon it, like I did, or take your time and watch one arc after another. The humour really got to me, the scenes were amazingly directed, even if a bit predictable, and the soundtrack was a pleasure to listen to. This is definetely an anime that touches me in all the right places. It almost feels like a lesser cousin to Code Geass of sorts. Not for even a second was I bored, it kept me entertained the whole way through. This is exactly what I watch anime for: fun.\n\n
Overall: 9\n
This is really one of the most unique anime out there. It may not be right up everyone's alley, but I'm sure that if you will give it a shot, you will not feel betrayed by any means. It is exactly what it seems to be, doesn't deviate too far from it, so if you like what you see, sit down and enjoy the bomb that is No Game No Life. I definetely did.\n\n
As always, this is purely my opinion and I highly reccomend you to develop your own.

~ Story ~
         No game no life begins with the something that is very common in anime, namely being dissatisfied with this world, and for some sort of reason being transported to another world. You might wonder why I give it a 8 when it already has been done many times before. The reason for this is that the concept is actually quite fun, a brother and a sister NEETs are the best in any games they play and see the normal world as a bad game, then at some point they are magically transported to anotherworld where everything is solved by games. Not very original as I've heard the story somewhere before in an anime which I can't even remember so unimpressive it was (and for some reason people turned into cats when they got hit???). The reason why I like this storyline so much is because of them actually never wanting to go back, this together with the some great storytelling makes it quite entertaining.


~ Art ~

         This anime has a very strong animation, it is very colorfull with a lot of pink or beige colors, maybe sometimes even too much. For some people this might be a pluspunt, for me myself I'd rather see it a bit less colorfull as it kind of distracts me from the main point, but overall the animation of this anime is one of the better points.


~ Sound ~

          I can't remember any songs or sounds from the anime after watching it so naturally it get's a low score in this one. I do have to say that I might be slightly biased in this since I have a very specific taste in music when it comes to songs and all other songs I just totally forget. The songs are very similar to other animes.


~ Character ~

          Even though the characters have an annoying brother sister complex where they can't be apart too far, the characters are still the best part about the anime and I especially like how they take advantage of the rules to the point where they are actually abusing them, and have no ethical uneasy by doing it. They both seem a bit whimsical at times, but their devilish side is what makes them so great.


~ Overall ~

          , I would recommend it for sure. It is ecchi like I said and it is set in a gaming world, but it's different than others I've seen which is refreshing. I loved it. It's smart, action packed, funny and definitely rewatchable.

After watching Death Note and Code Geass, I was sure that I wouldn't find another anime as good as them. (Spoilers)
So this anime begins pretty normally with a brother sister NEET relationship conquering every game imaginable. The idea that they are geniuses is somewhat hinted in the beginning, but you get to see their true colors as the series goes on. The siblings get recognized for being the best and being called cheaters in an online MMO by a God from another world. This God plays a game of Chess with them and immediately teleports them to another world. This world is governed by gamesand games alone. Everything from increasing your race's territory to owning someone's life involves playing a game. This series goes on to show how the two MC siblings, Sora and Shiro, delve into this new world and strive to conquer it as well. 


The art in this anime is somewhat different, but very appeasing to the eyes. The scenery is outstanding and the characters are designed very well. 


The soundtrack in this anime matched the atmosphere of whatever was going on in the show. It added depth and a great sense of emotion into the scenes. I have absolutely nothing bad to say about it.


The characters were few, but of great quality. We have the two MC siblings, Sora and Shiro, who are both geniuses at video games. Sora seems confident, outgoing, and sort of goofy while Shiro is somewhat reserved, cute, and collected. We also have Stephanie who is a goofy, clumsy ex-princess of the kingdom that Sora and Shiro try to help. Her character definitely relieves tension in the anime and is always nice to have around. All of the characters have their own colors and contribute something great to the show.


Overall, the show was amazing. It's one of those shows where you watch an episode and wish it was longer, but then go ahead to watch the next one and repeat the process until you kill it in one night. It's a great "smart" anime (for lack of a better term) that mixes comedy in with very likeable characters.

Rapid Reviews of No Game No Life
No Game No Life. A story about Sora and Shiro who never ventured outside and played any kind of games including video, card and board games. From their great talents they were dragged into a world where everything is settle by games. 
First off, I love this idea because being a heavy gamer of all types myself, chess, checkers, poker of all kinds, two-up, and many video games (as to be expected). The idea that wars and nations could settle such things threw these mediums is entertaining.
Second section here talks about the animation itself. Very smoothing and rich animationand with the colours using throughout separated from other animations I have seen to date. 


The voice action in the English dub was great and what i expected the characters to sound like in my mind. The sound track for this anime was also great with the opening theme and ending theme being enjoyable to listen to. In fact it is one of the few anime's I would watch all the way through because of them.


The story line was stated before hand and repeating myself, I liked the idea and the direction it went, too bad it was only one season worth for the moment but i am excited for the next one to be released.


Overall, I Really enjoyed this anime and would recommend it to my friends. Loved the animation and the soundtrack. The English dub was great.


Rapid Reviews gives a 9/10


Datrium Rapid Radium

This is one of those animes that you dont found very often. Even for someone like me who has seen hundreds upon hundres of different anime series, I dont remember the last time I was so excited week after week. It is based on the original light novel series, which are amazing too and very worth reading. I will be rating it part by part below, so you get a better idea.
Lets start with the story - 10
The concept behind the story is simple but at the same time is just plain awesome. For all those who like games (of any kind) and think youare good at them and want to show off your skills, this Disboard is for you. It's a world where everything is decided by games, and you can bet absolutely anything, even world domination. This is where our two main characters come in.


There is an urban legend about a group players known as "Blank" ("Kūhaku" in japanese) who are known for being unbeatable and have even won battles of 1000 vs 4. In reality they are a pair of hikikomori (shut-in) siblings who control 4 accounts at the same time!! The older brother "Sora" and the little sister "Shiro". They pass their days playing games in their room and avoiding the exterior as much as possible, but one day for one reason or another they found themselfes in this strange fantasy world where their talent can finally shine at its brightest, and there they decided to use that talent to take over the world and even the one and only God Tet. But that's enough story for now.


Now the art and sound - 10

I cant even start to describe how beautiful this anime is. The art here really brings out the best of the fantasy world with an immense amount of colors and awesome animation. Its the first anime I have ever seen to use a RED outline, instead of the typical black one. The character designs are vivid and memorable, and as for the soundtrack, Im listening at it as Im writing this. Both the opening and ending are incredible in their own way, but my favorite has to be the heartbreaking yet heartwarming ending, literally made me cry. 


Next are the characters - 10


There is not even a single character that I didnt like. Not only their designs are amazing, but their personalities are memorable, likable, and in many cases pretty badass (but that last part is mostly for the main characters).

Lets go over some of the most important characters.


Sora - An 18 year old brilliant NEET and the older brother of hikikomori siblings, and pretty much the character all the story is explained through. While not as intelligent as his younger sister who can calculate numbers as a super computer, he still shows an incredible IQ in his abiliries of predicting his opponents movements based on their behavior, motivations, background, etc. His ability to read the mind of his opponent and plan ahead of any situation is truly remarkable. He may be a little perverted at times, but he never goes to far, and as much as he wants a girlfriend, his little sister Shiro wont allow it.


Shiro - An 11 year old genius girl who loves her older brother Sora more than anything in the world. Both her and her brother have this dependece on each other that makes them inseparable as they cover each others weaknesses, making them truly the perfect team. She is a genius when it comes to logic and mathematical problems, but has a little more difficulty understanding emotions or the behaviourof his opponents, which is where her older brother Sora helps her. As smart as she is, she needs Sora to do pretty much anything (that also goes for Sora), and she becomes pretty jelous when Sora gets the attention of other girls, which just shows how much she loves him and means to her. She is also voiced by Kayano Ai, who also did the voice for another adorable silver-headed girl, Menma from Ano Hana, and also Roman from SKET Dance.

[She was my favorite character by far]


Stephanie, Dora / Steph - She is a cute but gullible 18 year old girl who expresses her feelings very clearly most of the time by her expressions, dialog, and actions. She is the character where most of the fanservice is shown through and its mostly a comic relief, but in a way its also the most relatable character in the sense that unlike all the other characters, she in a "normal" human/imanity and expresses the surprise and astonishment most people experience while watching the anime.


Jibril - Jibril is the youngest and strongest of the Flügelrace and has a intense desire for knowledge. That's pretty much all I can say without spoilers, but belive me, she is awesome!


Now lets move to my overall rating - 10

It is an awesome anime with a simple yet intresting story, likable and memorable characters, astonishing visuals and music, and great animation all around.


It has all the things I look in an anime:

-An intresting first episode that hooks you

-A good story that keeps you hooked

-A beautiful world that lets your mind wander

-Characters that you just instantly bond with

-Good music and visuals

-And a satisfactory ending for the season


I think this is the kind of anime that anyone who is mature enough to get over the occasional fanservice or any other "wierd/2Japanese4Me" factor, but any normal anime lover/otaku would absolutely enjoy this series. So if you can get over this, I defenitly recommend it to you, because it is truly what I consider a Masterpiece.

Going into No Game No Life, I honestly didn't know what to expect. In the beginning it seemed like it was going to be something along the lines of .Hack or Sword Art Online, where they like video games and end up being inside whether in a good or bad way. But it took a huge turn, in a sense of making NEETs become heroes in their own environment. 
The story itself is amazing; well plot out and turns where they need to be, leaving you on the edge of anticipation as well as keeping you brain reeling for answers. But there is also aglorious balance of character development that is clean and easy to keep up with as well as a very well planned balance of humor and seriousness that is tasteful. \n
What really kept me in awe was the art; vibrate, colorful ad beautiful. It really gave a taste of the world they had been given. It was also just nice to look at.\n\n
I recommend it for all anime lovers as well as just someone looking for a good story. And if you don't leave from it laughing or on the edge of your seat; you're watching it wrong.

Before I start, I have to say that this review may be a bit biased due to my love for "No Game No Life"(from here on i'll say NGNL for short).
People say that NGNL's story is a copy of "Mondaiji-tachi ga Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo?"(Problem Children Are Coming From Another World, Aren't They?), but I say if it has been done about 10 times better than the original, it doesn't matter if it has a similar plot line.
To me, NGNL is a work of genius. The story, yet slightly unoriginal, is amazing. It makes our world and it's laws and wars look utterlyidiotic as the people of NGNL can decide everything with games without pain, suffering, death or destruction. Sounds like fun right? This also means that it is generally the most tactical and knowledgeable people that have the power to obtain what they desire in their life.


The art in NGNL is amazing. It's flashy and fun and matches the tone of the anime almost perfectly. The landscape is especially nice with it's seemingly random and gravity defying scenery that gives the anime a fun yet alien feel.


For me, one of the highlights of the anime is it's sound. The soundtrack is bouncy and fun, sounding like it should come from a video game, matching the gaming style of the anime. The best part of the sound is the opening: "this game" by Konomi Suzuki. An absolutely beautiful song that I just can't hear enough of.


Im not sure if the characters in NGNL can be considered "original" but I don't think that really matters too much. All that matters is how they fit in with the story. You've got Sora, the cocky, perverted mastermind who is never short on cunning schemes and ways to win games and annoy Steph.
