(btw, my first review)
No game no Life is probably one of the most interesting plot stories I have seen until now, it has great originality with a story that you could not guess from a first glance or even the first half of the first episode. 
It is one of those anime that power ups with every episode,  it continuously surpasses the previous one with great and short comical arcs that each have a stroke of genius in them. This anime is unique in the sense that the thought process of the characters is simply brilliant, the closest similarity being "God's puzzle".
The characters areall very different and don't follow your mediocre anime girl or guy patterns, there is an incredible sense of uniqueness in these characters whilst also keeping the old school large breasted ecchi female characters as well as your lolicon types.\n\n
The art received my lowest mark not because it was bad, it was actually excellent, however it just wasn't as amazing as the other elements of the anime.\n\n
It is an anime that sent me reeling in my chair and unable to stop with amazing climax episodes (6 and 12) that could potentially cause some to orgasm from excitement.\n\n
If you can bother to watch the first two episodes I can guarantee the beautiful humour and genius "games" will make it a non stop marathon ending with you begging for a second season.

Just finished this anime, have to say I enjoyed it thoroughly. Haven't seen such a smart and fun anime like this in a while.
I especially love the musical accompaniment. It is absolutely genius! Like in episode 3 when Sora has to stop a coronation ceremony... and what does he do? He stops it by busting in the throne room and starts a CHALLENGE by playing electronic MORTAL KOMBAT music on his phone. Lol. Appropriateness = Godlike right there, as any gamer will testify.
Its not just comic timing either, the soundtrack is genuinely very good. There's alot of nice funky tunes in there. Its upbeat, modern,and of course sometimes a lil sad or mysterious when the scene warrants it.  Its so good I even want to buy it on a CD and listen to it separately. I also spotted alot of tracks that seems to have influences from old school Final Fantasy background music. A fitting tribute for an anime about games hehe.


Loved all the characters in this anime. There's no crazy evil villains out to commit unspeakable evils here (even bandits in this world are nice since they can't commit violence), just a whole lot of cute girls tryin to beat each other in games. Speaking of girls, this anime has probably the smartest way of handling censorship I've ever seen! I mean they have girls going totally naked, and boobs bouncing up and down.... The whole works! But its ok. Through their cleverness, the producers somehow made everything PG-13 family safe. Chk it out yourself to see how they did it. XD


Also extra points to protagonist Sora, who doesn't mess around and knows what to do right from the start (not a weak and useless crybaby). He's a manly man who knows how to get things done, with the appropriate appreciation for womenz, and none of that fake shyness or over-humbleness that permeates many-a-Japanese protags. Sora also happens to have a very good relationship with his sister Shiro. Now this is how good siblings should be. They back each other up, respect each other's boundaries, joke and have fun play around, and when the going gets tough, they're willing to put their lives on the line for each other. In animes recently, there seems to be a trend in brother/sister relationships where the sister yells abuse at the brother all the time, calls him a pervert and uses violence to smack him down. (Eg Oreimo). The story always implies this kind of abusive behavior as funny or acceptable. Other times they'll be straight up boning each other (Eg KissxSis), which is not good either to say the least... So major kudos to NGNL for showing a healthy and loving brother-sister relationship where they don't commit incest or encourage domestic violence.  


Good music, smart writing, funny jokes and out of nowhere popular references (ARROW TO THE KNEE!) makes this one of the most entertaining anime I've seen this year. I eagerly await the next installment!

No Game No Life , if I can describe this anime in one word I would use this : Awesome . But if you ask me why , I will tell you why : because it have one Original story which holds you till the end . In the start the art seemed strange for one anime about game but during the story it made sense of colors and shapes are that way because usually gets so used to a standard image (animation) but then becomes really "good" . About the sound I like it so much because it fits perfectly each situation since comicsscenes till the action . About the character I looked all character have your personality well-defined and explicit along the story . About the enjoyment I give 10 because even in action scenes you can have a good laugh and the action of some characters come to be unusual  . Finishing i really like this anime and think is a good option who wants some action , funny and some pervert things in one location and well-devolped not allowing some cliches screw up it.

BEHOLD!!! Anime of the year! Why you ask? The answer is art, story, characters, kawaii! Some may shy away from this show thinking "Another show about video games?" but this show differs in the fact that they aren't inside a game playing the game, they are in an alternate world playing games. What's the difference? They aren't trapped, in fact they quite enjoy the fact that they're stuck there. What I love about this anime the most is its genius strategies, very much akin to Death Note. Never before have I been so caught up in a game of rock paper scissors and I wasn'teven the one playing it (watch and see). The next best thing I love about it is the art. Very colorful and pastel, but what makes this one unique is the red outlines of the character and the light, omnipresent haze. I also love it for its harem quality. Yes, it's another harem and the characters pretty much know it's becoming a harem but it has some semblance of originality when it comes to how he goes about meeting these girls. The characters are all very cute and quite memorable, especially the sister. Another great quality about this anime is that it has a clear goal and that it has its suspenseful, hopeless moments and then it turns around and all I can think is GENIUS! This anime is sure to continue and I certainly look forward to the second season, this show is far from done.

TL;DR- Show is good, look at the ranking/ratings. Lots of blind love and hate for being popular, some hate justified over the excessive Ecchi fanservice involving Loli's, but overall a great show. Read on if you want to know how it stacks up in full.
Art-10:
Let's start with what you'll notice first, this beautiful art. While some might not like it (initially I didn't), I found it grew on me and really highlights the shows fantasy aspect. Character design is quite refreshing to me despite the generic 2 body types (Busty or Loli), I really like the use of vibrant colors with Jibril they do suchan amazing job of the innocent to evil transition that every time it makes me smile. Animation wise this is Madhouse and they don't disappoint, if you hate CG you might find this annoying but they really did such an amazing job particularly with the games. All in all this art ranks up in the best of the best to me.


Story-10:

Where to start, you should know the basics, two super genius gamers get summoned to another world. I won't spoil the specifics of why (you'll find out quickly), but it really is refreshing compared to the normal reason heroes from another world get summoned. The rules of the world are also of particular note, making all conflicts resolved through games, and forbidding more or less most forms of crime.  With all this setup I really thought NGNL wouldn't be able to keep up with its premise but honestly they do a great job keeping the world developing into this amazing place as we learn more about it. The games are fantastic, and keep trying to 1-up each other to the point where I really feel they'll have to run out of something more amazing to play eventually. All in all the story of NGNL is intriguing, to the point where I went to read all of the LN that has been translated, which gets a 10/10 from me.


Sound-10:

Often overlooked but the sound design of this show is AMAZING! Not joking probably the best in recent memory. They do such a good job of blending the scenes and sound together to make everything more memorable. I haven't yet got the OST to play yet but the music is extremely fitting and all the effects are spot on. I'm not a native speaker so I can't really comment on the VA but they all do a great job for me. The opening and ending songs are both great (though the OP is the standout), but just the song alone wouldn't make the intro so amazing, instead its the visuals and how it fits in when they play it (they have the usual clip before the OP). It always manages to fit in and never feels jarring like hearing Mahouka Koukou no Rettousei's OP start up in a way that just ruins the mood (I like the song don't get me wrong but when it plays it doesn't transition smoothly).


Character-9:

Honestly this is gonna be hit or miss with most. Personally I love them all, I think that they decided to abandon Steph, as they were setting her up to be developed out of a comic relief character but ended up deciding they wanted to keep here there sadly. Jibril is of course my favorite if you couldn't tell, a God-Slaying angelic scholar...seriously how am I to resist. She's also quite the two face being both angelic and demonic in equal measures. The main leads are a mixed bag, while I like Shiro and think she's quite fun, no real development of her other than portraying off her skills has been done. Sora on the other hand has the most amazing moment when he shows his true character late in the season, show just who he really is and managing to prove that genius and insanity run hand in hand for sure. Overall docking this section for the poor use of Steph and Shiro's lack of development or growth but even while I say this they're still top notch character compared to most shows.


Enjoyment-10: 

I've watched each episode twice, once by myself and once with my wife. I've also read the LN and am going through them a second time as we speak. The world here is vast and intriguing and the plot is equal measures serious and comedy. The only thing that could dampen your enjoyment of this show is a distaste of Ecchi and fanservice (including Lolicons) which this show has in spades (toned down from the LN). The fact that this show is nearly in the top 20 anime of all time while being Ecchi is a massive testament to how enjoyable it is, as ecchi shows have a rough rode since a fair amount are put off by it (particularly the loli girls). This show however unlike the many others does not fall pray to the fanservice first and instead uses it as juxtaposition to snap you from being serious after a game back into the more comedic atmosphere. While I won't deny the show could certainly be argued to stand on its own without the fanservice it would be a massive departure from the LN to remove it completely and I for one enjoyed how they handled it.

Story 7/10
No Game No Life (NGNL) follows Sora and Shiro, a brother-sister combo, that calls themselves the "blanks" and never loses a game. They're transported into a world where everything from minor arguments to disputes between nations are decided by games. There are 16 races and 10 rules that must be followed, and this story follows these two characters as they try to challenge god in a game.
Art 9/10
Whether you like the art or not depends entirely on you. This isn't just amazing art that's plain to see like Fate Zero or Shingeki no Kyojin. Instead, the art style is very vibrant and has acolorful tone. At first, the strange color palette was weird for me to get adjusted to like it was an oversaturated photoshop project, but it really grew on me and also helps give the vibe that this is another world.


Sound 8/10


Sound is pretty solid, voice acting is pretty good and music is fine, but nothing really extraordinary


Character 8/10


The characters are very interesting and likable for the most part. There are some moments when the characters feel too strong because the "blanks" never lose.


Enjoyment 10/10


Thoroughly enjoyed NGNL. Incredibly funny and just a blast to watch.


Overall 9/10


It's not perfect, especially because of it's lack of ending (maybe season 2) but it's just so fun to watch

Honestly I don't understand why people hate this anime. 
Sure, the characters do not get developed at all, they're mostly one dimensional and bland, and a couple of them are only there for the fan service. But one shouldn't deny the fact that it is by far one of the most enjoyable anime out there. The story is not meant to create any drama or suspense, but rather let audiences sit back, relax, and watch an anime that doesn't require them to shut their brains off. 
The art is beautiful and fits the atmosphere, the soundtrack is fairly decent, and there is never a dullmoment. \n\n
People should stop giving low score just because there is too much fan service or a certain aspect of the show doesn't meet their requirement. This show does well what it is made for. 8/10

PHYSICS! 
PHYSICS!!
SCIENCE!!! Oh Physics is in that category? Yes!
MATH!
MATH!!
Numbers!
Super Absurd Intelligence!
Super Duper Cute Smart LOLI and to metion a NEET!
I apologize for the hate of those exclamation marks ;p
Normally some other people would at least try to avoid those subjects at school. I forgot to mention, some kids who hated numbers would rather go more literary subjects.
No Game No Life did break that for you. Who would have thought that this show and especially the main characters make this super interesting and exciting in each episode? You will never be disappointed at all and even beg for the next episode to come out alreadyafter the other. Some other game animes totally have surpassed the others, which is this anime of course from my own opinion.


No Game No Life is one of the best seasons this year and I'm sure of that. If anyone says that this show is not that great, he/she must be missing something awesome once in a while. By the way, this show is beyond awesome or bad@ss! I call this a rare gem in the anime history, you might have a different one, but this is one for me.


Story 10/10


No Game No Life is all about two NEETs and legendary gamers back in their world. In the real world which is around in Tokyo. They are known as Blank or Kohaku for not having defeated by anyone in their record. They are impossible to defeat and some people have even tried to defeat this pair, which they undoubtedly lost in the game. No one knows about their identities in real life. They are actually outcast in the society as they have experienced depressing things in their lives.


Sora, he’s an 18 years old guy, the oldest of the two, and Shiro, the 11 years old LOLI who has massive of intelligence, above par than Sora. These two have encountered match between Tet, a God in a parallel world, as soon as they have defeated him. Sora and Shiro are summoned or transported to a world, which is ruled everything by games. No one would have ever thought these total two strangers in that world would be the saviors of Humanity or as they call it Imanity in that world. They are 16 races and Imanity is the lowest races since they are weak to the other races. They are defenseless and vulnerable. Some other races use magical powers, or great intelligence, while the others have strong senses than the others.


This is similar to the other animes out there like Sword Art Online and BTOOOM. They try to finish the end of the game to escape and go back to their normal lives. No Game No Life is different since the two main characters prefer to live in a world that is totally far from real life. Back in their world they are nobody and they are seen as weird. But the world they are invited in, these two are like celebrities that attempt to get at the top. The truth is, Sora and Shiro go to extremes to enjoy each game. Game is their life. 


Why? The development of each episode is very well thought. The 10 pledges are explained thoroughly that must be followed like the 10 Commandments in the Bible. Each episode also leaves the viewer for wanting more. Every match doesn’t look or seem dull, but exciting and you won’t even believe the gazillion plot twists in every match they are in. I promise, the storyline is really good! Even some principles of Physics are used in this anime. Some funny and good reference is included that I would never think that they will use. What else are you looking for, two total geniuses, LOLI! I’m sorry for loving lolis ==’, a pervert and funny oni-chan that has weakness over animal ear girls, a dim-witted Dola-chan, and a weirdo Flugel and that is Jibril to complete the good recipe of the storyline. The serious amount of time that they have spent and creativity is endless. The pure bad@ss moments and pure awesomeness will amaze you in each episode and even at the end of the anime, leaving you for begging more. Here, hoping for the next season already by next week or even nexth month.


The very well thought episode will leave the viewers in awe. There are some episode that are less exciting sometimes, but they do not fall from lower than good, it manages to be always far decent for most of the episodes. Now, I demand for the second season ! !


Art 10/10


This isn’t just the above anime art you will ever see. This is just totally awesome and I like the radiant colours that they use for this anime. We always see the standard black lines and here we will see the unique red lines. Shaft does this also, but I say MADHOUSE art beats Shafts this time. The vivid colours that are used give the surroundings to look more a fantasy look. Even in the darkest places they’ve showed looks wonderful in the eyes.


Sound 10/10


The music in each scene is suitable. I don’t really notice the background music in some scenes or I rather ignore them. Even the Openings and Endings in some other animes sometimes would rather to skip them and jump over to the main part. But the Opening and the Ending of this anime, I never even skip one of them LOL!


The OSTs that I ignore much, I liked them in this anime, especially when Shiro and Sora revealed why they win that match and explained it to their opponent. I can’t help but smile along their victory xD. The voices are also superb and fit every character in the anime.  


Character 10/10


The characters are fun to watch and hard to decide who you will be bias of. Since each character is lovable and Shiro’s virgin jokes to Sora are just fucking hilarious. 


I love the personalities of each character. Sora’s deceitful tactics towards Dola are darn funny. Seeing Sora’s appearance, you wouldn’t think he’s such a badass character at all until you watch the anime. Shiro the moe filled; her personality is rather interesting in my opinion. It’s rare to find an 11 year old girl with a good sense of humour, and is rather mature than her older brother.  

Kurami’s tough appearance kinda surprises me that she’s kind of a cry baby. I find Izuna-tan very cute along with Shiro, another moe filled again ;p. And the Shrine Priestess the new character never thought to have a cute character in that holy sexy appearance ! ! I want to see more of her xD. Geez, she appeared in the very last episode fuck that. I feel like I’m Sora at this moment xD. 


Enjoyment 10/10


Yes, I’ve enjoyed this anime and I’m not disappointed every week. Every episode is just fucking all worth of waiting. I hate waiting for new episode every week, I tend to wait for months and watch them in one go. But No Game No Life kept me starved for more. The cliffhanger that they posed kind of frustrated me, but the wait was all worth it when the new episode was out. The ideas that they used in this one was really exciting and interesting. 


Overall! Briliant! I've never scored an this perfect! Unfortunately, the show just ended and next week wouldn’t be as exciting like before. Anyways, I recommend this anime to be added to your list it’s totally freaking worth it. I’m wishing that the next season will be on its way to be released already T^T.

Please allow me to share my view on No Game No Life (NGNL). Forgive me if there is any grammatical errors or some of the terms wasn't used correctly.
Even though NGNL has a genre of Adventure, Fantasy and Supernatural, we shouldn't watch it in a much serious tone due to the addition of Ecchi and Comedy genre to it. While the story lacks in originality, *coughs* Mondaiji-tachi, Sword Art Online etc, the execution of the story is far superior than most of the anime with similiar storyline and plot. With fan-service throughout NGNL, to me it was a good addition although it may be alittle unnecessary at times. 


The art is definite a + point to NGNL, which is very, very eye-pleasing. The character design is top notch. The bright colours definitely stood out and showed the fantasy settings pretty well. It definitely sucks your eye onto the screen for a whole 23 minutes every episode.


Both the OP and ED are awesome. I can listen to both of the songs every episode without skipping it, which is very rare to me. What really stood out was the background music used. They were used at the right time and definitely succeeded in creating the atmosphere, especially during the battles.


If there is a downside to NGNL, it would be the characters. Both the protagonists, Sora and Shiro lacked of development and depth. While both of them have different personalities, it wasn't explained much in the series. However, what can you actually expect from a 12 episodes series? Any 12-episode series that tried hard to be perfect in every aspect will just fail miserably. 


I enjoyed this anime series very much. In fact, I stayed up late just to wait for the episodes to be released every week. Personally, I believe that we can enjoy any anime series that is interesting to us. It does not need to be perfect as in *the story must be original, art must be good, character development must be good and the list goes on*. What's the point if there is an anime that is perfect in every aspect but you just can't seem to enjoy it at the end? 


No Game No Life is definitely one of the must watch anime series of 2014. Heck who say's that only serious, dark or tear-shredding anime can be the top anime in MAL. 


As for the scores, I gave,

Story         - 8

Art            - 10

Sound       - 9

Character  - 7

Enjoyment - 10


Overall      - 9

Games make you stupid they say. Games harm they say. I say that "they" would change their mind after watching this anime. An anime that increases your IQ by at least 10%. Today's review, a short and unfinished (waiting for season 2) anime on the title "No Game No Life".
Plot and Story Line
First thing I want to tell you about NGNL is how I've watched it. I stopped after four episodes because, I don't know, it wasn't that special. Luckily I don't give up that easily and after I started again and finished the fifth episode, well I couldn't stop. Although it was the firstday of school the next day, I had to finish it., and yeah. I went to sleep at about 2:00 AM. But definitely worth it. The story is awesome, catchy and one of the most interesting storylines I've ever seen. 

Now, the story is basically about two need siblings, Sora, the older brother and Shiro his little sister. They escape their usual life trough the huge world of Games. They play all kinds of games, card games, board games, video games...And most importantly they always win as the couple known as "Blank". One day they get an invitation to a chess game, and as expected they win. Soon after they are transported to another world by Ted, the god of Games. In that new world everything is decided by, guess what, of course, games. Whether it's about a coin or a war between countries, games decide the outcome. Just a right place for the siblings that really aim their goals very high: their final goal, defeat Ted and become the new Gods of Games. But will they succeed or not? We don't know because the first season finished half-way and we are still waiting for season two to air. The makers are sure keeping us on tenterhooks. 

First thing that has to be mentioned as a part of the whole plot is the sibling relationship. Forget all sibling relationships that you saw before because this one will top them all. It is not a sad story, nor did they have a hard childhood. It's just so funny and cute. I mean they are so used to each other that they can't even be one minute away from each other. Just KAWAII. They would probably be nothing without each other. It's like they fill up the emptiness of the other one. They would be nothing without each other. 

But now the thing that really makes the whole anime so special. The intellect, the strategies, the plans and brilliance are incomparable with any other anime (well maybe code geass). Both of them Shiro and Sora are masterminds in their own class. Working as Blank together they are invincible. Every strategy and plan, and every single move is being explained in details. That's the thing I was talking about in the beginning that increases your IQ.It is sooooo interesting to listen to their explanations and make everytime :"Ooooh, that's what he did" in the end. Sooo amusing, I promise you that. 

When it comes to the storyline it really has no flaws at all. No plot holes, no stupid twists and it keeps your attention till the end. In short, please release the second season! 


Characters:

This dude is so damn funny. Although SORA is a little pervert I liked him. He is a typical NEET yet brilliant when it comes to strategy and plans. He is very communicative and outgoing, and energic. He has that sudden reactions and emotion-breakouts that make him so interesting. Yet, the most important reason I liked Sora is how he takes care for his little sister. Too cute!


This girl looks like an emotionless doll, or more a very intelligent robot. SHIRO does not show that much feelings but damn she is smart. She is so good at numbers and and logical problems making her solve almost everything. It was so hilarious to see how her brother-complex awakens when Sora talks with other girls. Jealousy was always a funny thing. Kawaii, little genius. 


Animation and Style 

Now this is definitely something different. The animation of NGNL fit perfectly with its story. The style, the colors, the brightness...It was just perfect. And the character design, epic. I mean, the characters just look like they should. It's like their personalities were pictured in human form. I hope you get me. :D You probably open some pictures before you go and watch an anime, here is one screen-shot of Disboard  for you...


Conclusion: 

No Game No Life is not an actual action anime. So if you want a lot of action this is not for you. But I promise you, it's worth every single second because it's so interesting and catchy. I love anime where the main characters are masterminds that entertain you using only their cleverness and wittiness. That's why I love NGNL. It's not one of my favorites but, in my opinion, definitely deserves a rating of, let's say 8,46. 

Your AnimeGirl

STORY - 8
ART - 10
SOUND - 9
CHARACTER - 9
ENJOYMENT - 9
The genre of 'Game' isn't the first thing that come to my mind when I'm searching for the next anime to watch. But No Game No Life, to my surprise, was very entertaining and completely exceeded my expectations.
As a former gamer, it was actually intriguing to find that the main characters were highly skilled sibling gamers classified as being urban legends themselves. Their skills and strategies along with the strong relationship both possess is a strong factor this anime have. Those characteristics plays an interesting role in the parallel world they were transported to. Allconflicts were to be resolved through the rules of games, exactly fitting for the duo gamer. Let's just say that the smart strategies involved in these games were amazingly put together to create tense sessions of game between opposing sides. And who are the ones who faced off against the sibling? I have to say I found the girls to be really fun to watch, even when a couple felt tropey. The backstories was a welcome addition that adds depth, and the intelligence some have made for great matches between them and the sibling gamers. Also, another surprise was that the comedy, fueled by fanservices, wasn't actually as irritating as I thought it would be and instead succeeded at making me laugh. This'll be different for some of us, but I'd say it's due to the excellent nature of the characters that the comedy connected well like a puzzle.\n\n
Focusing at an aspect I found to be awesome was the art. I was totally off guarded by it. The parallel world is vibrant, tinted by a lively set of warm colors that suits the fantasy genre. It removed boringness and instead embodied the word 'beautiful'. Entrancing in my eyes is a good way to describe the world. Of course, the animation added the last boost for me to give art a perfect score. The smooth animation gave life to the world and bright energy for the actions. I also have to mention at the solid efforts for the sounds. While the OSTs and SFX was great and all, the voice acting stood out for me as it captures the personality of the characters. I enjoyed the characters even more because of the emotions and expressiveness contained within the voices.\n\n
No Game No Life was an enthralling anime of games. A vivid world where the sibling apply their skills of gaming to win conflicts is a premise I find to be entertaining. Especially with the funny and fascinating side characters, the anime worked greatly as a comedic enjoyment with compelling battles of who can outwit their opponents the best.

This show is wild. It sets up a wonderfully interesting world controlled by a fun mischievous god who wants someone to challenge him in a game of chess. Isekai antics ensue. When telling me to watch no game no life my friend told me that it isnt THAT generic of an isekai and he was both wrong and right. It isnt generic in the sense that the harem isnt in love with him, and he isnt overthrowing some demon lord. The show is fun as well, and you can get some enjoyment out of it. Along with this the show is very good looking andthe OP is a bop and a half. But thats where my praise has to end. \n
The plot armor in this show is BEYOND enormous, this combined with the fact that the rules are set up and nothing is done with them (the rule on cheating specifically felt like it was only set up so we could see that our protagonists were edgy kiddos who cheat to win and can get away with it). The flimsy world building is complimented by a healthy amount of waifu eye candy (I like the angel girl best).\n
 My biggest gripe with the show comes down to the last episode. We all know the protagonists are going to win, so the final twist isnt really that much, but they take what could be a wonderful and possible touching moment of character and turn it into another "Oh hey look at how overpowered our protagonists are they planned SOOOOOO far ahead hahahaha buymymerch" moment.\n
Other than this as well as some other moments in the last episode, the series isnt particularly offensive, and im upset that it was cancelled as im sure it could have some potential, the last few moments give us a glimpse of this. But with what we have, this is the score I have to give it.

Another over-thought, attempt at being clever anime that completely misses the mark. 
- On our first introduction to the characters; a 15 year old dead-beat and his 11 year old 'genius' sister is ruined by a G*ddamn panty shot. I nearly stopped watching there, but decided it was stupid to judge the anime on one bad choice. 
-The duo is known as "Blank" in the online world, and after being whisked away to a parallel world, begin the process of overthrowing the government(s) by playing games -> which is the way all issues are settled in this world. 
I like the premise of a worldwhere all disputes are resolved by games, it could have been interesting. Instead it falls flat on its brothers c*ck. Oh wait, that was the 11 year old sleeping on her brothers crotch. Nevermind. 


-The wholes series tries to shoe-horn in how unbelievably skilled these two are, if it succeeded at anything, it was how unbelievable it actually is. The convoluted methods the characters go through to justify how they win makes me think the writers sat in a room for days planning this out, giggling at how terribly clever they are. No. The more the characters talked about strategy and how they won, the more obvious it became that the writers really weren't clever. 


This anime is less about games than it is about a harem though. Of course this loser 15 year old NEET just happens to stumble upon the most gorgeous women in all the land and of course they all love him and want to do him - his sister included. Its tiring and boring. This is probably how "Nice Guys" view the world. 


The animation is fine. Its modern and had a little same-face going on, but the costume designs range from interesting to "did you even try?" Bad girls have tits, good girls kinda do. Blah blah blah. Harem anime. I'm too gay to care about this shit. 


The best thing I can say about this anime is that I love the opening. The anime has the substance of deep-space, but at least the opening has a decent beat going on. 


People I think will like this anime: People who hate themselves, masochists, Nice Guys, Perverts and people who don't know what "taste" really is. 


People who will hate this: People who've seen the best anime has to offer. Spare yourself this BS anime series and go watch FMA:B or a Miyazaki movie. Any of them.

This show makes me unhappy. Not because it's bad mind you, but it's because there is no second F--kn season. This is actually a VERY good example of a good and innovative echhi anime. And by innovative I mean that it can actually go 5 minutes without a upskirt or boob flash. Actually now that I think about it it's not character and story driven rather than go to the brim of "damn near porn". The characters rebound perfectly from each other and just aren't some stupid floozys or brainless perverts. I think the story is well done and it compliments the art style perfectly.The settings and premise make sense and the characters aren't some carbon copies of someone else and actually have personalities of there own. Nothing feels forced or contrived, and you know what... the only problem I have is what I stated in the beginning, if there was a conclusion to the story I would be happy. Alas it may never be. But here's hoping.

This show is complete trash. It's not only a cheap quasi-ecchi Isekei, its completely boring. At least Sword Art Online had some entertaining points about it.  I wish I never saw this show and really question how the average score is hovering around 7 when there are so many other series that are averaging 7 that are completely better.
Story:
Very dumb storyline. Not much else to say. Two overpowered brother/sister combo with an unhealthy incestual relationship faceroll everyone in the world through betting on games. The teenage perverted protagonist is a super-genius capable of making Einstein look like a moron.
Nothing new, and its all boring.


Art:

The art is the one redeeming quality of this show. It is a pretty anime, and I suspect that is the reason the scores are relatively high (shallow viewers). 


Sound:

Decently adequate music and sound. The production values are high. Style over substance here.


Characters:

Completely terrible. There is absolutely no development and depth to the characters. 


Enjoyment:

None. I am a fool for forcing myself to sit through this whole series.


Overall:

Must avoid at all costs unless you love seeing a brother/sister duo grope each other while cheating at chess, cards, etc to overtake a virtual world.

Where do I even begin with this review?
Should I begin by praising the Godly opening,which has accumulated more than 85 million views on Youtube?
Should I begin with the Art Style, which is the most beautiful and gorgeous I have ever seen(After Kimi no na wa)?
Should I begin by mentioning the numerous amount of mind games that take place throughout this anime,which are on the same level as death Note?
Nope. 
The thing which makes this anime a masterpiece,towering above the others is its female characters. All of them are stunningly beautiful,and you even get to see them naked every now and then.The thing is,this anime managesto do that without compromising on the story.\n\n
The anime keeps getting perverted,which reaches its peak during the last two episodes.Trust me,such masterpieces are rare,so watch it if you haven't already.\n

"There's no way to know the rules or the goal, yet there are 7 Billion players making whatever moves they want. If you loose too much or win too much, there are penalties. You can't pass your turn, and if you talk to much, you'll be ostracized. There are no parameters and no way to even know the genre. This world... is just a crappy game."
Once again, anime has made me question my existence on this earth... The more anime I've watched and loved, I have found myself asking the same question over and over again, "Why was I born into the wrong world?". I'msure there have been quite a few of us that have asked the same question. For the Fairy Tail lovers, you all wish that you could be a Wizard in Fiore. For the Naruto lovers, you wish to be a Ninja and learn all kinds of Jutsu. For the Pokemon lovers, you wish to have the opportunity to catch them all, only in real life and not just in a game. My point that I'm trying to make: this world is boring.


Not only anime does this though. For years, gaming, television, and books have been building up people's expectations for what reality should be like, and when those people realize the horrible truth, we resort to watching/playing/reading more and more about the worlds we wish to live in. It's a saddening truth, but we have to live with it.


Now, I'd like to welcome you to an anime about 2 people who, like us, feel like they were born into the wrong world, and get their opportunity to escape into a world 1000x better than ours. Ladies and Gentlemen, I present to you, my review, on No Game No Life.


Story:

Sora and Shiro are two siblings living the life of your ordinary NEET. Only, they aren't really average at all. They play games, yes, but they are literally unbeatable. No one knows anything about them and the lives they lead. The only thing everybody knows about them is that they always leave their usernames blank. Despite their skills in any game imaginable, they are bored of the world they live in. That's when they get the opportunity from a so called "God" named Tet to be reborn into a world where everything is decided by games. Follow 10 simple rules, and you can prosper. Follow these siblings as they try to reach their goal and beat the God of this new world, but it's gonna take some time, effort, and a whole lot of planning, but I'm sure they can pull it off. After all, they are Blank.


The story piqued my interest from the very beginning, and with every twist, turn, and the jaw dropping season finale, I really hope to Tet that Madhouse Studios doesn't pass up the opportunity to continue this series.


Art:

Speaking of Madhouse Studios, they've been known for some pretty big work, such as the infamous Death Note, Black Lagoon series, and Chobits. However, it's been a while since I've seen anything they've come up with that deserves a lot of hype. No Game No Life is their golden ticket. Some of the most insane yet beautiful artwork I've seen in a long time. The view of every single part of the world was amazing. It was colorful, beautiful, detailed, just brilliant. And the character designs were all good. Now, let's hear 3 cheers for the return of drawing characters with triangle mouths! \(o^o)/


Sound:

If they ever come up with an English dub for this anime (I really hope they don't personally), they better get one hell of a cast, because I'm pretty sure that all the Japanese dub actors and actresses made the characters sound as good as they possibly can. They put so much realism into their acting that it was probably one of my favorite casts up to date. And then there's the soundtrack, and holy mother of Tet was it good. The opening is probably my favorite song off of the entire anime soundtrack. I never skip it.


Characters:

Sora VS Light Yagami. Sora VS Lelouch. Sora VS Keima Kasuragi. All of these are interesting match-ups, and the thing is, I have no idea who would win in any of those fights. The thing they all have in common? They're all geniuses. Sora is intelligent, funny, highly relateable to when it comes to women... at least in my case. He's one of my favorite MCs in all of anime. Shiro IS my favorite MC. It was a tough fight between her and Kirino... but Shiro has her beat.  Same qualities as Sora, only I'm pretty sure she's less curious about boobs than Sora is. She's also on the quiet side, so that gives her a little bit more of a mystery to her personality. Then we got a bunch of other characters, such as Steph, Jibril, Izuna, etc. They all had their good traits to them. I didn't dislike any of them in particular. There were a few moments where I thought they were jerks, but it all kind of evened out in the end. Good set of characters overall...


Enjoyment:

I enjoyed NGNL. I really did. I'm upset that I have to wait for a second season that might not even come. This anime had good humor, great animations, a kickin' soundtrack, fun characters, and a plot that made you think about a whole lot. Oh, and there was the story as well.


Overall, NGNL is worth the hype it's been getting. A lot of people might not think so, but in my personal opinion, this should be a must-watch for all anime fans.

Hey there! First things first, this is my first review and i’m not a english speaker. This review contains my humble opinion and SPOILERS, hope you like it and if you have different point of view i would like very much to discuss it 
The story
One day two siblings who happen to be a urban legends in the internet with the name Blank (literally [  ]) are invited to a simple game of chess by a boy, who happen to be a God from a fantasy world. After the game that was simply to acknowledge their capacities they are transferred to his world. Aworld where "everything is decided by games", there is no war and no violence only games.

These two siblings have never had lost a game and do not have that intention as after a little while living in this world they decided to stay and a little forder even help Imanity (humanity) to have the right to challenge the one that put them in this world with their talents. 

I remember the first time that i read the title and think this would be another anime that did what it suggests: ‘’if the characters die in the game they die in real life’’. It wasn’t and i’m glad they didn’t go that way. It still was that game anime type formula where the characters that incredibly good at what they do and have to face a various number of challenges each one more difficult and with more importance than the other that will change something in the future. 

So it’s a simple but interesting plot, but what makes No Game No Life different is that the main characters embrace this new world and even try to rule it and where in others you find difficulties and parts where you doubt the heroes (even though you don’t want to) are going to lose here you just know that Sora and Shiro, the main characters, had already everything and i mean every little thing planned and there is no chance they will lose. And this is what i think it can change your opinion about the whole anime, either you are okay with seeing no problems (at least almost none) and hard time to the siblings and focus your attention to how they do it or either you will probably dislike this entire show. It has to be about you and your taste i guess.


The characters

Sora and Shiro are not surprisingly NEET and hikikomori gamers with poor social social life, until here nothing really new unless the fact that they are siblings. Let’s face it if this two were actually real life people they would be miserable. This thing of romanticized lonely people is not cool. Even though both are known for being both the main characters i got the feeling since the beginning of the show that Sora is the most important character, he gets more screen time, more monologues and play as the voice of both. But he wouldn't go anywhere without his beloved younger stepsister, literally as away from her hebecomer ‘’ a spineless, cowardly wreck, and only returns to his former self if he is able to see her’’. Sora is extroverted, observer and a bit pervert. Not that unusual. Shiro is quite, cute and more intelligent in logical problems, at first i thought she would be a little annoying but i was wrong and i ended up liking her character very much and i wish she was/will have a little more of devolvement. They both work perfectly and if Shiro wasn’t there it would be a lot more boring. 

As for the supporting characters there is a bit to say, and the first one that comes in my mind is Steph. I really like her role in the story as granddaughter of the latest Imanity’s king. She’s emocional, naive and not as intelligent as Sora and Shiro or any other supporting character to be honest but she is smart. Steph is the dummy character that is needed for the viewers to understand and to catch up with all the games that are played in the show which for me was really useful to be honest. But a problem in her character and in Jibril’s too (all right most of the female characters) is that because of all the fanservice they lose a lot of point and presence. The name of the anime is since it came out knowing by how much fanservice it has is which i think it’s bad ‘cause starting to watch it only for the fanservice takes a little of integrity of the anime story and anime itself. Don’t take me wrong i really liked to see Steph in glasses, Jibril it’s a powerful angel for god sake and i don’t wanna talk about that fox lady from the last episode but the moment that fanservice start to overcome the character trades like it does in NGNL is a little too much especially if they are this important and powerful. 

Other characters that i found interesting but weren’t that developed were Chlammy and Feel. They appeared a good quantity of time and yet it feels like they were just another character for Sora and Shiro sudden benefic. 


Art and soundtrack:

I will be 100% honest here the thing that actually put me in watching this anime was the art. I had never watched an anime like this and added with fantasy was an amazing thing. It’s colorful and fun just like a world about game sound be. I mean if it was dark why would you wanted to run it? Look at those the backgrounds, they are all about fantasy and games (exactly what this show it’s supposed to be about).  I will search for the people who made this kind of artwork in the future.

For sound track i got a positive opinion as well. I don’t think the soundtrack stood out as the art style, i don’t think it has a memorable specific song that you will want to heard on it’s own. Unless we are talking about the opening song that one it’s amazing specially the piano intro, i got this feeling of adventure and excitement just for hearing it. I had to putting on my phone i just really like it a lot. 


Enjoyment and overall:

There are a few reasons i can’t got a higher score (again a huge one is the fanservice) but the main one was that sometimes i simply got bored, the games weren’t challenging and i like to know how they do it but if there is no difficulties there is kind of no point. I don’t understand people who say this anime will change all the game-type animes. It has new things yes but it’s not good enough for that, at least to me it’s a bit far from that. I only started to get a little more attached to the anime maybe in the last 3 episodes. Only after i watch them i change the score. It felt like it dragged a little to make the viewers wait for something really big that didn’t happen. They left the story hanged which it would be good if i knew there was going to be a second season. If there is i’m really hoping it will get better, a lot better. There is so much potential in this show it’s a little disappointing if they just keep it like this. I wouldn't just drop it but i wouldn't be excited to watch it.

This was an interesting anime, it kept me intrigued and wanting to know what was going to happen in the end. However, at the end it lost me. I still watched it to see what was going to happen, but sadly I ended up being confused and saying "WTH is this bull honky." The reason is that the story would get me mixed up, it jumped around so much. Sure I understood the siblings goal (they made that clear from the get-go) and that the developers were trying to explain everything (the races, the world, how everything worked, etc.) to the viewers so they theywould understand this world, but it all happened in a mishmash of episodes. In other words, it was all over the place. I may just have been me, but I had to go back and re-watch so many times to figure out what was going on. Sometimes it wasn't clear what the siblings plan were in an episode and how it made any sense in this game world. Nevertheless, this anime is a good watch and I hope they have a second season so that they can explain what in the heck is going on. Also, they could lay off the red tint or whatever they used because it looks odd. Yeah, it's suppose to look like a video game but it makes everything look weirdly colored. \n\n
Overall, weird but good story, beautiful music, oddly colored red tinted art but a pleasant watch.

No Game No Life (NGNL) is an anime that involves so many things that made it the highlight of Spring Anime. Character development is amazing, Art is fantastic, and the plot is one that can keep you hooked until you've finished the anime. Especially when you see the ending to this amazing anime, it'll make you want to see a second season! *Lets hope for a second season*
STORY 10/10
The plot is really unique to the anime, since it was unique it pulled the viewer in immediately. The to protagonists Sora, and Shiro are brought into another world; not just any word but a gaming world.The main objective is to vs 'God' which is also a gamer too. How will Sora and Shiro get to vs 'God' then watch the anime. The strategy involved in the anime is outstanding as well, you will sit there astonished at how strategic each game is and what will awh you even more is that someone took the time to think out each strategy and move. Finally, sure there is a little bits of Harem and ecchi here and there but it doesn't effect the overall feel of the anime, if anything it makes it more enjoyable to watch.


ART 10/10

The Art in the anime is very spot on, it has a lot of bright colors that all mesh together bringing forth a very colorful anime. All the colors, designs, background detail are all amazing and fully represent this anime for what it brings to the table.


SOUND 10/10

The intro to the anime is outstanding! It is very catchy and it would make the viewer want to get the full song because of how good it is. The Outro is like wise. The times as to when they put in the sounds that would fit the scene is spot on. When you expect a sound/soundtrack to be played then and now is there.


CHARACTER 10/10

Each character has their defining moment that makes them who they are. Each character plays a role that made this anime worth wild, each of them were there to help out strategically as well; so none of the characters were pointless they all played the part.


ENJOYMENT 10/10

I found this very enjoyable because I love the strategy in the anime, I love each character for the part they played and I loved how there is an objective they need to achieve to win it all. I Especially like the voice acting they were all spot on to the character for example *Spoiler* Sora is played by Kirito's voice actor. That made it very enjoyable for me to watch.


OVERALL 10/10

This anime is deserving of it's spot at Top 50 animes. It is also deserving for a second season! I liked it a lot, and I think you'll like it too.


NGNL MUST WATCH! DO YOU EVEN SECOND SEASON BRO?

NO GAME NO LIFE - 6/10
Very good, dynamic, enjoyable, stylish, smart, interesting, full of fanservice and just what else could you possibly want?
This anime can be smart and serious, at the same time use borderline ecchi content to keep it silly and not so serious, and it actually goes deeper than that. The whole point of this show is that the whole world is a game, nothing just happens, it all is a set of factors that causes something to happen, and with knowledge of these factors, it can be changed.
So the show is set in a world where everything is decided through games, thosegames apply to strict rules and such, and you can see how smartly the protags use these rules.\n
Aside from that, the show is mildly entertaining, full of dubstep, and is just not in my taste. 2modern4me. Maybe 14 year old club kidz will like it more.\n\n
It's a fun show, if you take it too seriously you will probably hate it, but that's just the way it is, and it's very enjoyable all the way through. Perhaps concluding the story in one season is impossible but still kind of annoying that it ends so abruptly and you don't really feel closure, and i guess it's lacking any kind of depth really, i mean if you'd want to you can shove an uterior 2deep4u meaning in the most animes out there now.

this one is in my top 5 . that’s how much I enjoyed it. If you want an anime that is just fun , an anime that will make you laugh with witty unpredictable moments and face palming stupidly( anyone who don’t agree ,what was you reaction when he decided he would fight the war beasts )then this Is a show for you . and if not ,are you're allergic to fun happiness and joy? then go watch helsing ultimate in that case its good show without those . Sora and shiro step brother and sister , they both have social disorders both are geniuses in there own way, sora can read people  so well that he can anticipate their reactions in any situation (essentially he know what your planning before you do ) , shiro can learn vast amount of information and able to decide what is the best course of action (shes a computer) together they are unbeatable . and as such they don’t take any situation seriously. and when they are betting the human race that something that some people might take seriously. but they just don’t care because their so confident their going to win, in any situation even in a game of chance like paper scissor’s rock. how can you be so  confident in a game of chance you might ask,  well that’s easy add a little  PHYSIOLOGICAL WARFARE IN TO THE MIX aka psych them out (I like my words better). The remaining cast are a female bumbling sidekick a female powerful fugle (race also known as god killers ) who was a bright loving  ex mass murderer back in the days before tet , a female human and elf who are best friends (maybe a little closer I don’t know )who that believe that shiro and sora are going to get humanity killed  . you might have noticed the lack of men then you might notice if you watch the show the increasing number of scenes that take place in the group bath. (not NSFW though) the animation is  bright which fits a world where no violence stealing or murders exist and it sound though nothing stands out in my mind is still as good as most anime .


 if your thinking about watching this show i would highly recommend . which i've only said about 4 other anime. trust me on this you wont regret it 9/10

Well this is my first review, so I hope that I won't look stupid writting my thoughts here 
I actually don't get people who are saying that this show is s**t. Well first of all I think that watching anime should bring enjoyment to people. This show may be overrated right now, but I don't consider this anime anywhere near bad, I mean it should totally be in a top 50 at least. I may not be an expert on anime like some people are, but when some anime with alternate world comes up, people are immediatly pairing it up with SAO, well maybe SAOwas one of the first series coming with an alternate world, so what? Then why not pair up all romance animes and say that they are the same? "Main protagonists in SAO and No Game No Life(NGNL) are almost the same" - well I don't see how people come to that conclusion, the idea of the main hero being an outcast or "one vs. the world" is used in a lot of animes, but that doesn't make me dislike them. Besides this show has some huge potential in my eyes and I think if it will turn out good  in plot, then it will shine even brighter than now.


Now for the review


Story - The main plot in NGNL wasn't something brand new, but it was actually a good mixture of genres. It made me laugh, it made me fired up from time to time and for about last 4-5 months it was the only anime that made my hair stand up from excitement. I think this still was a breeze of something new this year, because it was finally a show that lied close to my heart, it was serious, it was funny, it made me sad that I watched it, because even overwatching it won't bring back those same emotions/feelings. (9/10)


Art - To me the art was flawless, it was a bit different from other animes, but it managed to make my eye relax watching it. Don't know if I should mention it but it was all good, no creepy backgrounds like in Pandora Hearts. (10/10)


Sound - the sound was also well done, the Opening and Ending themes were enjoyable, but not very memorable and they brought a little more atmosphere to the anime. The voice acting (Japanese) was really good, all the characters had the voices that suited them pretty good in my opinion. (9/10)


Characters - This is were the show really shined. All the characters were well done, there were no "filler characters", because all the characters who were introduced played a role in the main story. The main protagonist wasn't anything special, but in my language there is such a saying "Everything brilliant is simple", so I think that he was looking just the way he had to. As for the other characters (Almost all girls) they were all really pretty and had something special to each of them in their looks. They were all kawaiii and had a veriety of race, personality and *cough* breast size :) . And by the way I didn't read the light novel, but what gender is Tet or a God doesn't have a gender? It's bugging me for some reason. (10/10)


Enjoyment - I really enjoyed it to the fullest, everything was to my liking. I don't know what to say more here. (10/10)


Overall - It was really an awesome time watching this anime, I don't know how some people may put it under 5, but I guess we are all different. I would recommend it to everyone who likes brain games, cute girls and just positive and not dull animes.
